Dante grabs Juliette's hand and says they all need to calm down and Jolene realizes they're sleeping together and says Juliette is the disgusting one. The next day Juliette sends Jolene home with Emily, who is charged with getting her a new,female, sober companion and she informs Jolene that Dante is now her manager.

Back in Nashville, Scarlett signs her contract and Gunnar decides this is cause for celebration which ends up in a night out drinking with their new neighbor Will. After Will and Scarlett perform an impromptu duet at the bar, she confides in him that Gunnar hasn't written any new music since his brother died. After she goes to sleep, Will takes Gunnar out to shake him up. They dangerously race a train and although Gunnar is upset at first it does in fact make him feel alive! The next day he heads back to the publishing company and begins working on a new song. Meanwhile, Juliette heads over to Edgehill with Bucky-- Rayna couldn't make it because of Lamar-- and she is toasted by Marshall and the whole Edgehill staff and they congratulate her on being the first signing to Rayna's label.

description: Juliette and Dante go house hunting. Jolene says she saw Dante kissing the realtor (Esme) who tells Juliette they're just old friends. Dante "finds" Jolene's pills, but Juliette later realizes they're not hers. Deacon and Juliette butt heads and when Dante gives him instructions, Deacon gives notice he's leaving after this leg of the tour. Deacon tells Stacy he quit, ... Read all
tags: ['kiss', 'gay kiss', 'unwanted kiss', 'unexpected kiss', 'imperative in title']
synopsis_with_character_names:
"Nashville" - "Take These Chains From My Heart" - May 1, 2013

We open in Cincinnati with Dante in the shower and Juliette explaining that she has to move because the owners are returning. She invites Dante to go house-hunting. He accepts and then she joins him in the shower.

Gunnar is reading his dead brother's journal and Will rides up on a motorcycle and offers Gunnar the keys.

The plane touches down in Nashville and apparently Deacon and Rayna got a chance to catch up. Rayna tells Bucky with a few days off she wants to get going on Scarlett's album.

Jolene meets Dante and Juliette at the airport complaining about her new sponsor. Juliette tells her she needs to respect boundaries.

Teddy finishes up a meeting with Coleman and the rep from Subway about the new stadium. Teddy laments that Lamar will still see some coin from the deal from contract work. Peggy arrives and kisses Teddy and he backs off and says they need to be discreet and since he has the girls he needs to back off for right now. he takes a call from his lawyer and says he'll meet.

Deacon, Stacy, and Scarlett have dinner and Scarlett says her signing a solo deal with Rayna has upset the dynamic of her and Gunnar's relationship. Deacon says he'll talk to Rayna.

Rayna meets with Liam in the studio. He notes she's feeling better. She says she just wants to live in the moment and having her dad almost drop dead helped with that perspective. She says she feels free. Liam asks how free and they start making out. And then Bucky arrives and just about catches them.''

Will plays his first gig and the ladies love him. Gunnar watches appreciatively. Will gets a girl's number. Gunnar also watches this appreciatively but really likes his swagger onstage.

Rayna and Tandy help Lamar back into his house and he's all grouchy and combative saying he is neither dead nor doddering. Rayna tells Tandy she kissed Liam. Tandy wonders what's next. Rayna doesn't know. Tandy tells her to have a little fling. She says it's scary and that they went to second base. She wonders if this makes her slutty.

Juliette and Dante make out and look at houses while she is supposed to be rehearsing. Deacon asks her to join them. She demurs, and Dante butts in. Deacon asks to speak to her alone but Juliette refuses. Deacon says he'll finish off this leg of the tour but then she needs to find a new bandleader. She dismisses this and says it's fine and he's replaceable.

The lawyer tells Teddy that the Peggy was indeed the leak. Teddy can't believe it

Rayna meets with Scarlett to start talking first single and tour. Scarlett brings up Gunna and that he had a death in the family. She notes that Rayna once said there would be no her without Deacon and she notes there would be no her without Gunnar.

Will and Gunnar talk swagger and how to achieve it and how to zero in on girls in the crowd. Will says Gunnar should try it that night at open mic night at Tootsie's.

Jolene arrives at Juliette's rehearsal and announces that she saw Dante kissing another woman. Juliette calls her crazy. Dante says it was his realtor and they weren't making out and mostly he's concerned that Jolene is following him. Juliette kicks her out.

Avery tries to sign up for open mic night but he's too late their full up. He does get their early enough to catch Gunnar's act with and his new attempts at swagger. It seems he is a quick study and he and Will have a swell time singing a great power pop song. The ladies love it. Avery? Not so much.

Liam and Rayna holding hands in the studio and Liam says he wants to whisk her away to St. Lucia. She says with kids, dad out of the hospital, and the tour she can't. He says she has a few days off after this tour and she said she wanted to live in the moment. She says she'll think about it.

Stacy and Deacon unpack groceries and he tells her he's done with Juliette, he says it's time he lived in the real world for awhile. He asks if that's okay and she answers with a kiss.

Juliette and Dante look at a house and she admits she's worried about her mother and what she said. He says they have to keep an eye on her so she doesn't relapse. Dante takes a call and Juliette calls Emily over and says she wants to meet Esme the realtor.

Will and Gunnar drink at the bar and a girl comes up to Gunnar and slaps her number down on the bar. Even better a guy named Jack Nelson comes up and says he wants to record the song he sang as a demo. Will asks if he's going to use the number and Gunnar tells him to knock himself out. Avery is also sitting at the bar and he compliments Gunnar's song and apologizes about the way he acted with Scarlett. Gunnar points out that he and Scarlett are together now and Scarlett got a record deal. Avery takes that in.

Rayna goes to hang with Lamar and he's poring over her clippings. He says he may not have agreed with all her choices but he still followed her career. She gingerly broaches the Watty White subject and says she had no idea how difficult that was for him. Lamar shuts that down. He says he wants to start all over with her and he wonders if they can. She says she thinks that would be nice. They look at old family photos and reminisce.

Teddy confronts Peggy about the leak. She says she didn't mean to and says a reporter tricked her into confirming the story and then she felt bad so she didn't tell him. She promises she didn't do it on purpose and then spills the beans on Lamar coming to her and trying to get her to persuade Teddy on his stadium site. She protests that they love each other. He says that's not enough and asks her to leave.

The next morning Scarlett tells Gunnar the good news that Rayna is willing to take him too but Gunnar doesn't want that anymore. He says she knows who she is as an artist and he's just figuring it out and after last night at Tootsie's he has something he wants to do on his own. She says she just wants him to be happy. He says he is and they kiss.

Deacon and Stacy walk hand in hand backstage and bump into Liam. Liam charms Stacy. Rayna arrives and they exchange hellos. Rayna says yes to St. Lucia for a few days.

Juliette meets with Esme the realtor and confronts her about her relationship with Dante. Esme says he was her sponsor and saved her life. She says they were never involved, just friends. Juliette says she'll take the house.

Scarlett bumps into Avery backstage at the show and he explains he's a roadie. He says he's very happy about her success. She thanks him but clearly pities him.

Teddy is signing papers as Coleman comes in. Teddy says he's canceling all city contracts set up with Lamar. Coleman protests that some of those contracts were set up as a favor to him. He calls Teddy impulsive. Teddy says they'll figure it out.

Juliette brings Esme to confront Jolene. Dante and Juliette ask her if she's been using. They find drugs in her stuff. She denies that it's hers. Juliette tells her to stop lying. Dante says it's time for her to go back to Riverside.

Onstage Rayna thanks Liam and they hug. Deacon, at the side of the stage with Stacy, sees something in that hug. A fan calls out a request for an old tune and Rayna protests Liam doesn't know the old ones. He immediately starts playing it and he says he knows the cool old ones. Stacy asks Deacon if this one he and Rayna did together. It is. Liam and Rayna duet very cozily. Deacon fidgets uncomfortably and tells Stacy he's going to get some water.

Tandy tells Lamar it's late and he needs to not be working. Lamar says Teddy has canceled their contracts because Tandy ratted out the Lamar/Peggy connection. Tandy says that Teddy has been part of their family for 13 years and she was showing him respect. Lamar counters it is his company, not Tandy's and he says after all that's happened that it was Rayna was there for him and isn't acting like he's lost his edge. He bids Tandy a dismissive goodnight.

Stacy goes to find Deacon and asks what that was all about. He is diffident. She asks if when Deacon came back by the previous week if he was really there to see her or to see Rayna since her dad was in the hospital. He says he came to see her but did stop by the hospital and is sorry he didn't tell her. She asks if he still has feelings for her. He admits he does but that he's trying to be in this with her. She understandably upset walks out saying she needs a little time and they run into Rayna.

She asks him if everything's okay. He says no and tells her what happened, tearfully. She asks "what's the matter?" He says "you." He says he's been trying to fight this thing between them but everytime he gets close he can't make it happen. Liam arrives to whisk her away. Rayna says they're going to St. Lucia and that Deacon needs to make it right with Stacy.

Coleman and Tandy meet for dinner. She says there are some changes coming to the company. She says they both now it's time for Lamar to take a step back and Tandy to step forward. She wants to propose a new alliance with Coleman since they both know Teddy is wrong for the city and that they both want what's best for Nashville. She tells him to look into Teddy's past for some ammunition, especially in the Cumberland deal.

Emily reports that she got Jolene back to her place. Juliette is distraught she thought her mother was going to make it this time. Then she looks more closely at the drugs and starts to get a sinking feeling. The drugs can't be Jolene's: she is allergic to what's in them. Suddenly, realizing that it was Dante who "found" the drugs on her and Esme who vouched for them and then she handed them a big check she is very interested in finding Dante. Emily calls and it goes straight to voicemail. A crew guy reports Dante picked up the show money and claimed he was going to pay the crew. It would appear that Juliette has been had.

Post-show Scarlett chats with Avery at the side of the stage. She asks if he's miserable. He says no, he's just making the best of a good opportunity. She says it's nice to see this version of him again. Avery says he's trying to get back to who he was. He asks why she's still there. She says she wasn't ready to leave just yet since it's not every day she gets to be backstage at an arena. He invites her onstage. "Kinda cool, huh?" She agrees.

Rayna goes to Deacon's and says she was at home packing but she had to say something. And that something is "I love you." He freaks out and asks her what she is trying to do to him and that just two hours ago she was jetting off with Liam and telling him to get back with Stacy. She says she just wouldn't feel right and he can do what he wants with that information. She goes to leave and he grabs and kisses her. (And it is awesome.)

Emily reports to Juliette that another $475,000 is missing from her corporate accounts and thinks they should call the police. Juliette doesn't want anyone else to know. She asks Emily to call her mom and tell her she doesn't have to go back to rehab since she doesn't think she can do it. Emily asks her what she wants to do about this house she bought. She says she's still buying it, as a reminder to never trust anybody.

Gunnar is working on a song and having beers with Will. He says the song he sang at Tootsie's was from lyrics his brother wrote and that he was the talent in the family. Will jokes that Gunnar told Jack Nelson the song was his. He laughs and says he didn't know how to explain it. A little dark. Will asks if Scarlett is mad that Gunnar decided to hang with him instead of going to the show with her. He laughs and says things have been getting pretty weird and he doesn't know how to fix it and that maybe he's kidding himself thinking it was going to last forever. Gunnar asks if that sounds stupid and Will says no and then Will tries to kiss him. Gunnar freaks out and kicks him out as Will protests that he didn't mean it and he apologizes.

Rayna and Deacon finally get it on. For reals.

Dante and Esme sit in first class. His phone rings, it's Juliette. He folds the phone in a magazine and sticks it in a trash bag proffered by the flight attendant. On the other end of the phone Juliette, incensed, throws her phone at a mirror and cracks it.

description: Rayna and Deacon are back together. Juliette finds out Dante's embezzlement was just a start. Rayna and Juliette are both nominated for the same CMA award and the label throws them a party where Juliette gets smashed. Right before stage time Juliette lays into Deacon who quits on the spot, so Avery steps in. Teddy asks Maddie to let him take her to the Father-Daughter... Read all
synopsis_with_character_names:
"Nashville" - "Why Don't You Love Me" - May 8, 2013

Juliette gets drunk. Rayna gets down. Gunnar gets duplicitous. Avery gets dutiful. And Coleman gets out of the way in tonight's "Nashville."

Juliette, in her quest to keep the police -- and more importantly, by association the press-- out of her train wreck of a life, hires private security to track Dante, freeze her accounts, etc. She has also started drinking, heavily. But amidst the doom and gloom she gets the call that she has been nominated for the CMA Female Vocalist of the Year. Her excitement is tempered only slightly by the fact that Rayna is nominated as well.

Since Rayna has already won 4, Juliette is hell bent on having Marshall and the record company focus their efforts on her but when they please low budget, Juliette takes it upon herself to launch a million dollar campaign to woo CMA voters. She then finds out that Dante has spend $17,000 on an engagement ring. Presumably, not for her. She also keeps drinking. Enough to worry even her mom.

Enough that when she show up at the CMA nomination party that Rayna dubs her perfume 80 proof. Enough that she screams at Deacon while he and Rayna are trying to have a conversation so he quits. Enough that she then hires Avery to play for her show-- he does very well-- and then try to hit on him in her limo. He declines and she is sad she can't even pick up a roadie. Her security guard pours her back into her house where Jolene tries to tuck her in and console her as she tearfully wonders why nobody cares about her. And then Dante really lowers the boom. He calls and Juliette asks what he wants. And then all we hear is her say "What kind of tape?" (Looks like a Juliette sex tape is in the offing.)

Meanwhile Deacon and Rayna are all lovey-dovey, schmoopy with each other in bed but when the real world starts to encroach things get tougher. In an effort to be honest with Teddy she tells him that she and Deacon are tentatively an item and he goes ballistic noting there's no way Rayna can have a relationship with him and not eventually tell him that Maddie is his biological daughter so she should call it off. Apparently, they had an agreement that he would never be told when they got married.

Rayna tries to pull back, saying they should take it slow. Coleman tries to warn him that he shouldn't blow up his whole life for a woman who has messed with his mind over the years. Stacy is heartbroken when he awkwardly breaks up with her and gives her his dog to boot. Tandy tells Rayna she should just treat it as a fling. But warning signs be damned, they find each other too irresistible and when he says he knows she's not telling him something and that he doesn't care she melts all over again in the back of her limo on the way from the CMA nomination party.

While this is going on, Teddy is dealing with a sullen Maddie who blames him for the divorce. Whatever you want to say about his philandering, Peggy Kenter ways, he is a great dad and loves her even knowing her paternity. He convinces her to go to her school's father-daughter dance and eventually goads her into dancing and she has a great time. She later tells him she's glad she went but misses that they are not a whole family anymore.

While he's patching things up with Maddie, Teddy gets a break-up note from Coleman. When Coleman realizes that Tandy, Teddy, and Lamar all have their guns pointed at each other and each was trying to use him as a pawn, he wisely realizes if he just gets out of their way they'll destroy each other and he can likely swoop in and pick up Nashville's pieces.

Across town Gunnar is still weirded out by Will but he didn't say anything to Scarlett about it. He's too busy stealing his brother's song to record a demo with that producer who heard him in the bar with Will. He goes off to do that while Will and Scarlett go to the CMA nomination party, schmooze with industry people, and get confused when they see Avery onstage with Juliette.

Gunnar cuts his demo, his producer loves it and asks if he has more. He shows him Jason's notebook of song idea and he loves them but has trouble reconciling the outlaw type songs with Gunnar. He says it's all true except where the statute of limitations has run out, ha ha ha. So it looks like he plans to steal all of Jason's songs. Later, as Scarlett returns from the party he's listening to the demo and she gives it a spin and says she likes it too. But later she finds Jason's notebook and kinda can't believe he took Jason's song. He shrugs it off saying it's just a song.

description: Dante sends Juliette a blackmail demand. Juliette asks Avery to help with her new song. Gunnar goes on a radio show; Scarlett doesn't like what he says and gives him a piece of her mind. Will uses information from Scarlett to crash Rayna's auditions. Will and Gunnar get in a bar fight and Gunnar misses Scarlett's debut at the Grand Ol' Opry, but Avery makes it. Scarle... Read all
synopsis_with_character_names:
"Nashville" - "A Picture From Life's Other Side" - May 15, 2013

A lot of action in tonight's penultimate season one episode.

First up is Rayna's label announcement. Marshall wants to close the deal on two artists by the end of the month and get going. Rayna knows she's got Scarlett, and will introduce her at a show at the Opry the following night, but she and Bucky decide to hold auditions to find a male artist.

When Will gets wind of the super-secret auditions from Scarlett he shows up and talks his way into an audition and wows Rayna and Bucky with his swagger and voice.

Meanwhile Gunnar is running himself ragged recording Jason's songs and trying to build an "outlaw" image to fit them. When he goes on a radio show and claims that he's a bad boy who does what he wants, Scarlett wonders what is happening to him and asks Will to speak to him.

Will heads down to a gig where Gunnar is playing up said image and when a guy at the bar wonders where Gunnar did the time he sings about, he and Will get into a scuffle that lands them in jail, which causes them to miss Scarlett's debut at the Opry.

The debut itself is a triumph. Even though she is nervous and calling Gunnar, Deacon helps prop her up and then she gets a box from a friend in the audience: a whisk from Avery. It is very sweet. She finds him in the audience as she sings and it perks her up and he just beams at her. She receives a standing ovation.

The next morning in jail Will and Gunnar commiserate. Gunnar thanks him for having his back. Will says it's not his first time in jail but it doesn't seem like Gunnar. He replies he doesn't know what's "like me" anymore. Will apologizes for "that thing" he did. Gunnar apologizes for overreacting saying he was just surprised. Will admits that when he was 17 that his dad caught him with a friend and asked him to explain himself. He couldn't. His dad said he couldn't live under his roof while he figured it out. So he hitched a ride to Abilene, got a job, and learned guitar. Gunnar asked him if he ever figured it out. Will says that all he knows is the only time he's happy is when he's playing and singing. He's going to be a country star no matter what it takes. Gunnar agrees he is going to do the same.

Scarlett bails them out and Will promises to pay her back. Gunnar tries to apologize but Scarlett isn't having it. She says she fell in love with Gunnar, not his brother and she wants no part of what he's doing.

Meanwhile, when Lamar starts showing signs of forgetfulness Tandy tries to lay the groundwork for a coup. But Lamar shows up unannounced at a board meeting and reclaims his place at the head of the table.

Juliette's goes from frying pan to full on fire. After a brief writing session with Avery in which she says she doesn't believe in love because everyone who ever loved her betrayed her, she gets bad news from Dante.

He wants $2 million for the SD card of the sex tape he made of them. Juliette still doesn't want to involve the police and have a scandal right before the CMAs so she sets up a meeting to hand off the cash. Dante doesn't show and decides to up his price to $10 million. Juliette decides to simply come clean and sets up an interview with "The View" and tapes a statement saying she has made mistakes but this time she simply fell in love and trusted the wrong man.

But just as she's about to appear on the show via satellite she gets a desperate call from Jolene. After going on an oxy and booze bender, she called Dante and told him she'd give him the original two million in exchange for the card. But when he shows up, she shoots him instead and then overdoses. She calls Juliette and says her goodbyes and throws the SD card in the garbage disposal.

Juliette arrives to the apartment and weeps over the wreckage. Later, catatonic with grief and anger she watches the news reports of the shooting and overdose.

And finally, Deacon wonders when he and Rayna can stop sneaking around. She says she needs to talk to the girls but in the meantime invites him over to dinner with them.

They're getting cozy playing a tune when Teddy shows up unannounced and pulls Rayna aside. He reiterates that he doesn't want her to see him or have him around the girls. She says it's not up to him. She notes that her opposition to Peggy was that he was having an affair. He counters that she was having one the entire time they were married. She tells him not to rewrite history and that he can't dictate what she does.

Except the next day Teddy serves her with a restraining order. Rayna can't believe he did this and Teddy tells Rayna that he finally did what Lamar said and he grew a pair.

Rayna tells Deacon about the restraining order but says she can still see him. Maddie overhears her saying I love you and so Rayna sits her down and tells her it's Deacon, that they're seeing each other, and it's grown-up stuff and when she's old enough she'll tell her.

Rayna visits Lamar and asks him to help with the restraining order. Lamar says he'll take care of it.

Teddy and Rayna meet up in court and the judge admits that Lamar called him but it was just to put in a word for keeping the proceedings quiet. He lifts the restraining order and says that they will need to return to court in two weeks.

Maddie goes snooping in Rayna's closet and finds a strongbox.

Rayna goes to see Teddy and says she wants to come to an understanding like reasonable people reassuring him that he will always be Maddie's father. She notes that he has trusted her all this time to keep this secret and that he needs to keep trusting her. He agrees.

Unfortunately, inside the strongbox Maddie found a paternity test. She calls her friend in tears saying that she doesn't think Teddy is her father.

description: Rayna tells the girls she's dating Deacon. Deacon gives Juliette his condolences on Jolene's death and she blasts him. Maddie tells Deacon she thinks he may be her father. The US Attorney's office notifies Teddy they're investigating the Cumberland deal. When Teddy contacts Peggy he hears surprising news. Scarlett and Avery meet for a meal. Gunnar brings flowers home ... Read all
synopsis_with_character_names:
"Nashville" - "I'll Never Get Out of This World Alive"- May 22, 2013

Juliette meets police who note Dante was a pretty lousy sober companion. They figure it was a drug deal gone bad or a lovers quarrel.

Deacon drops by to offer his condolences. She is angry and tells him to stop trying to help people he can't help. She tells him to buzz off so she can go to the CMAS.

Glen and Marshall go to see Juliette backstage at the CMAs. They try to convince her not to play. Juliette says her mother, a drug addict and murderer, was the one who melted down not her and she's fought for too much to miss this moment. Marshall says she should take time to grieve. She says she should be celebrating it's finally over. She stops and says she didn't mean that. Glen offers to take her home, but she wants Emlly.

Juliette goes to see her mom's body at the funeral home, all laid out. She says she had wanted her to see her win. And now she's all alone. She takes her mother's hand and tells her she's so sorry. She recalls singing her mother to sleep, like momma's do with their babies. But it was always the other way around with them. She asks how she could leave her and cries that now she has no one at all.

Glen shows up the next morning with Juliette's award. She won. She asks if there's anything else. He says yes and hugs her.

Jolene's very small funeral consists of Juliette, Emily, Glen, some security guy, and Avery. She asks him for a favor.

The cops clear Jolene's apartment and give Juliette the SD card from the garbage disposal. They couldn't get anything off of it and give it to her. She claims she didn't know what was on it. Emily is handling mail and hands Juliette a letter from Jolene. Juliette realizes her mother was protecting her by killing Dante and then herself. She writes that Juliette deserves to be clean and free.



Teddy gets a call from an old friend, Dashiell, who is with the U.S. attorney's office and wants to talk to him about the Cumberland deal. Teddy is not happy.

Teddy admits the embezzlement to his lawyer and that it was "handled" by Lamar. He figures Lamar tipped off the Feds. The lawyer says the worst case scenario is the feds find the smoking gun, Teddy goes to federal prison. The smoking gun is Peggy.

Teddy meets with Peggy in a parking lot. She says the US attorney came to her also and offered immunity but she turned it down. She's pregnant.





Rayna and girls watch the sad news about Juliette's mother. She tells them she is dating Deacon.

Maddie goes to Deacon and tells him she thinks he's her father.

Rayna is prepping for the CMAs. Deacon shows up at the last minute and he and Rayna go on to perform a new song with Brad Paisley. Deacon has no time to say anything. Brad and Rayna sing a song called "Bitter Memory," Deacon seems distracted.

Post-show he visits her dressing room and tells her about Maddie's visit. He wants to know that she hasn't been lying to him every moment of the last 13 years. He wants to know how it's possible. She says the fact that he can't remember is how it's possible. She asks him to remember how he was. He says he does. She says she got pregnant, married Teddy, agreed to get the paternity test after they were married, found out and Coleman told them not to tell Deacon, to "cut him loose," because it would interfere with his recovery since it took him five rehab stints to get sober. He is, understandably, freaked out and leaves. She starts to cry. A production assistant comes in and tell her she's on to present an award in 40 seconds.

Rayna calls Teddy and tells him Maddie knows and to be her partner in this to get Maddie through it and to come to the house.

They try to talk to Maddie who is packing a bag. They try to explain. Maddie is angry saying that Rayna lied to Maddie and to Deacon and she wants to live with Teddy and runs out. Rayna goes after her but Teddy stops her saying she promised him he wouldn't lose her and now he's promising her the same thing and to let Maddie work it out.

Simultaneously, Deacon proceeds to get drunk at a bar. He asks the bartender to turn off the CMAs.

The next day Rayna calls Coleman and asks him to go find Deacon.

Rayna goes to Juliette's mom's funeral and calls Deacon once again, hoping he'll be there.

Instead he's chasing after Teddy at City Hall and starting a fight. Teddy says Rayna deserved better than him and that he hasn't changed. Security tackles him.

Rayna offers her condolences to Juliette. Juliette explains she grew up in the dirt and now she gets to put her mother back in the dirt. She lived her life knowing this day would come, dreading it, wanting it, hating herself for wanting it. She always thought if she was good enough her mother would get better but she was never good enough. Rayna says she is good enough. She asks if she knows if Deacon is coming. She doesn't.

Gunner finds Deacon puking off his porch. He helps his drunk ass in. Gunner asks for advice on Scarlett. Deacon says he has none and shuts the door in his face. Gunner calls Scarlett and tells her to get Coleman there stat.

Coleman and Scarlett show up and Deacon is in a drunken rage. He is destroying things. He tells Coleman to leave, he tells Gunner he's not good enough for Scarlett. He charges Coleman screaming in a rage that Coleman told Rayna to cut him loose. It is chaos. Gunner pulls him off. Deacon apologizes to Scarlett. Gunner ushers her out as Coleman subdues him. Deacon says he doesn't want to talk. Coleman says that's fine but he's not leaving.

Coleman calls Rayna and tells her to stay away. Deacon wakes up. Coleman tells him he talked to Rayna and got the story. Deacon says he's not ready to talk about that yet but he wants to go to a meeting. He says he gets that he just washed 13 years of sobriety down the toilet. He says he plans to go get his new welcome chip at the 8 o'clock meeting and Coleman says he'll be there.

Rayna talks with Maddie and explains she married Teddy because she loved him and also so Maddie would have a father and that she loves her more than anyone in the world and she's never going to leave her. They cry and hug.

Deacon showers and takes some aspirin. Juliette calls him and he apologizes for not being at the funeral. She says it's her fault for pushing him away. She says she's having a memorial at the Bluebird and asks him to come. He says he'll be there and then takes a slug off a bottle.

Juliette holds her memorial at the Bluebird. She admits her mom was a mess but she was her mess, and she loved her and her biggest dream was to see her sing at the Bluebird so she dedicates a song to her mom with Avery backing her up.

The audience includes Rayna, Marshall, Glen, and a drunk Deacon. Rayna spots Deacon and goes out to meet him. He tells her to go back inside. She realizes he's drunk and tells him to slide over that she's driving his car home.

They drive and talk, we don't hear what they say. The conversation becomes heated and Rayna swerves to avoid another car and Deacon's car flips.





Jack and Gunner meet and he admit he stole Jason's words and the outlaw thing is an act and his girlfriend doesn't like it. Jack says he's not serious about career if he's going to chuck it over some girl he's not going to remember in 10 years.

Will thanks Scarlett for bailing him out and tells her to work it out with Gunner. But she's having breakfast with Avery. He tells her she was truly great. And she says it means a lot coming from him. Avery hopes Gunner is treating her right. She says they have things to work out. He claims he's sorry to hear it. She says he's not. He tells her to come by his gig that night.

Gunner brings Scarlett flowers and asks to start over since he came clean to his producer. She's unsure. He asks what more she wants. She says she doesn't know what she wants and that she's late to see an old friend play.

Gunner goes back to Will's and walks in on him with a girl in bed. Gunner is confused. Will says he's going to be the next big thing in country music and he'll do what "that" takes. Will tells him about seeing Scarlett with Avery.

Avery calls Scarlett to come up and sing a song he wrote for her a long time ago. She does and, of course, that's the moment that Gunner walks in. He orders a beer and drinks as they sing.

Scarlett and Gunner meet and talk. We don't hear what they say. He touches her face and gets down on one knee and proposes.

Will is in a restaurant with his new girl when a cute waiter appears to recognize him. He silently wills him away with his eyes and a small shake of his head.

Lamar demotes Tandy in favor of a board member who is his yes man. She quits and says she's just his daughter now and apparently he can only be on good terms with one of those at a time.

US attorney Dashiell confronts Tandy and says he wants to talk to her about Lamar.

description: Ariel rides a wild seahorse named Stormy against her father's wishes and gets lost in the wilderness.
tags: ['seahorse', 'giant animal', 'wild horse', 'king', 'dinner', 'octopus', 'disobedience', 'horse', 'talking crab', 'talking fish', 'talking octopus', 'sister sister relationship', 'father daughter relationship', 'kingdom', 'horseback riding', 'crab', 'fish', 'spaghetti', 'capture', 'one word title', 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure', 'character name in title']
synopsis_with_character_names: Ariel sees the wild seahorse Stormy and thinks she can break him on her own, although her father disagrees. Ariel takes Stormy out one night and gets lost in the wilderness. Two octopus cowboys attempt to wrangle Stormy, but are somewhat unsuccessful. Eventually Triton and the original Seahorse trainer find Ariel and convince her that what Stormy really needs is to be free. They free Stormy after Ariel agrees, and Triton gives Ariel another seahorse that thinks more her style.

description: Ariel became friends with an orphaned merboy who has fallen in with the underwater gangster 'Lobster Mobster'.
tags: ['one word title', 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure', 'character name in title']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In this episode we are introduced to Urchin, a brand new character that will become part of the series' central cast. This episode showcases a different view on friendship, and how even something as simple as the desire to have a friend can be harmful. To be true, pick your friends wisely.

Lobster Mobster and Da Shrimp are a pair of undersea crooks who are out to "take over" something before an even more notorious crook named Crab Louie arrives in Atlantica. They encounter Urchin, an orphan merboy who pretends to be independent and tough as nails, but actually craves friendship. Lobster Mobster pretends to offer friendship in the guise of joining his "gang", which Urchin eagerly accepts. First task as part of the gang is to steal some food. When Urchin hears that the Neptune Ball is underway at the royal palace, he sabotages the dance and makes off with a sack of food during the commotion. However, his actions are witnessed by none other than Triton, Ariel and Flounder.

When Urchin swims away, Ariel and Flounder chase after him. Ariel, curious and not at all angry, confronts Urchin about the stolen food. Ariel offers a hand of friendship to Urchin that is different from that offered by Lobster Mobster, but Urchin is reluctant to take it. Even so, Ariel has never been one to give up easily, so she tries again... Only to be captured by Lobster Mobster, who wants to use her as a hostage to get Triton's treasure.

From here, Urchin surprises even Ariel when he shows his true colours: he's actually a nice kid, and a clever one, at that. Thinking on the flick of his tail, he comes up with a plan to save Ariel, and then later to remove Crab Louie, impressing even Triton himself.

All in all, it's an excellent introduction to a lovable character who's flawed in places but has a heart of gold something he shares in common with Ariel herself.

description: Ariel babysits two twin merbabies.
tags: ['two word title', 'shark', 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Lord and Lady Clambakersfield have returned to Atlantica to have their toddler mertwins blessed by Triton. Ariel volunteers to babysit the twins while her father gives the babies' parents a tour of his kingdom. The babysitting gets off to a shaky start when the twins get into everything and are kidnapped by the Lobster Mobster. When the twins accidently get stuck in a bubble from the Lobster Mobster's bubble gun and are almost eaten by a giant squid, it's up to Ariel & friends to rescue them. In the end Ariel concludes that despite everything babysitting is pretty fun and volunteers to do it again whenever the Clambakersfields come back to visit.

(It's helpful that Ariel loves babies, considering the timeline of that episode and when she had her own daughter Melody in TLM2, which was supposed to be set only 2-3 yrs later.)

description: Ariel gets a Message in a Bottle, which leads her and her friends to a Dangerous Seamonster. Only to find out, that it isn't so dangerous...
tags: ['hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure']
synopsis_with_character_names: Ariel finds a message in a bottle, which Sebastian thinks is a human note, but it turns out to be from a lonely sea monster named Simon who was just looking for a friend.

description: Ariel puts on a human bracelet but finds it hard to take it off afterwards. Afraid of how her father would react, Ariel runs away to find the key to the lock of the bracelet.
tags: ['one word title', 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure']
synopsis_with_character_names: After getting her magnifying glass destroyed by Triton, and a warning never to bring another human thing back to the castle, Ariel becomes apprehensive when the gold charm bracelet she found in the great abyss gets stuck on her wrist. She goes back to the abyss/underwater canyon to retrieve the key and gets sucked underwater into the underground caverns. Ariel then has an 'Alice In Wonderland' type experience in the caverns after an eel boy tells her she can't escape, and she has to wait it out until her father comes to help.

description: Ariel believes her father King Triton is setting her up for an arranged marriage with a snobbish merman-prince of another sea kingdom of Olympia named Prince Thor.
tags: ['hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A rumor is spread around through Urchin and the sea clams that Triton has arranged a marriage between Ariel and the King of Oylmpia's son a mohawked merman named Prince Thor. Thor knows that their fathers just wanted them to pair up for an aquabatics tournament, so he goes to Atlantica to check out Ariel...but after having a prophetic dream* about Ariel and seeing Thor arrive in Atlantica, Urchin panics and leads Ariel to believe Thor's there to marry her! They try to trick Thor into believing that Ariel wouldn't make the perfect partner, which leads to a mini-war between Olympia and Atlantica, until they try to put a stop to it.

*Urchin's prophetic dream about Ariel was a brief one where he comes back from somewhere and discovers she's "left and never coming back," which led him to believe she was marrying Thor...but we all know her future ultimately. ;-)

description: Ariel accidentally frees a dark figure known as the Evil Manta, who tries to take over Atlantica using deception and lies to turn its merfolk people against each other.
tags: ['three word title', 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure', 'character name in title', 'title spoken by character']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Episode is also called "In Harmony"

This episode deals with the simple things of friendship and harmony in the diversity of the underwater realm. Also, it introduces us to the Manta, whom I think is the best villain of the animated series.

The episode starts with Ariel and Flounder seeing off Triton, Sebastian and Urchin as they leave to watch a turtle race elsewhere. Left to their own devices, Ariel immediately drags Flounder to explore a dormant volcano outside Atlantica. There, they suddenly hear a voice, small and helpless, asking for help from inside the volcano. Though Flounder thinks it's a bad idea, Ariel lets it out, only to find that the small creature was in fact a giant Manta, who thanks her with a wicked chuckle before heading for Atlantica.

There, the Manta uses his charms and hypnotic powers to turn the Atlanticans against each other. He exerts his strong influence on them one by one, teaching them to stick to their own kind, and soon enough the Atlanticans are forming exclusive "cliques" and refusing to mix around with anyone else. Fights, verbal and physical, break out all over Atlantica over the most petty of things.

Ariel and Flounder try to trap the Manta in a net, but he's too powerful and escapes easily. So they decide to use a different approach, and try to reason with the angry Atlanticans, and to help threm remember how wonderful their lives had all been when they were openly sharing their world. In particular Ariel tells them to believe in their hearts, and not to just blindly listen to what any outsider says about each other.

description: A magic spell turns King Triton into a young and energetic merboy, and Ariel has to play "the mother" to him.
tags: ['one word title', 'color in title', 'shark', 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Triton thinks he's feeling old, so Ariel wants to help him so a greedy blowfish, bent on stealing Triton's treasure, gives a suggestion. The blowfish goes to an anonymous sea witch in a cave who gives him a magic rock and flute. When he hands Triton the magic rock and blows the flute in secret, Triton is suddenly transformed back into a 10 yr old merboy, who insists on being called "Red."

Ariel has to spend her day babysitting 'Red' and gets some good practice in for being a mother, especially of a precocious child, but in the end 'Red' transforms back into Triton before he sea witch can get his trident, and the greedy fish gets what he deserves as well.

description: Before a family trip to the Carnival of Tides on the tide, Ariel and Arista get into a fight and are 'beached' and Sebastian had to stay and look after them.
tags: ['one word title', 'carnival', 'parody to home alone', 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Among Ariel's sisters, the one we know the most about is Arista, if only because Arista can't stand Ariel's headstrong ways. In this episode, Arista and Ariel come head-to-head at last.

It is time for the Carnival of Tides. Everyone in Atlantica is looking forward to it, especially King Triton's daughters because there appears to be something for everyone to do at the carnival. Sebastian has been given the task of gathering all seven girls and getting them ready to leave. Ariel, as usual, is late because she's hanging out with Urchin and Flounder.

As soon as Ariel does come back to the palace, she gets into a fight with Arista. Why? Over a comb that Ariel found and actually belongs to Arista. It isn't really much of a reason to start a fight, but Ariel and Arista don't need much of a reason because they just don't get along. Sebastian tries to get them to stop fighting but fails. When King Triton sees what's up he declares the two girls beached and bans them from going to the Carnival of Tides. Sebastian, of course, is then assigned to be their babysitter.

As you can imagine, neither girl takes very well to this, and they immediately start blaming each other.

It looks to be another boring being-stuck-at-home thing, until the Gators arrive. Specifically, Flo and Ebb Gator, freshwater thieves. Their target is the royal treasure, left unguarded in the absence of King Triton's trident.

Ariel and Arista quickly develop a truce; the Gators are the biggest threat, not each other. If they work together, they can stop the fiends from reaching the royal treasure. Oh, and Sebastian helps, too.

As things go on, of course, Ariel learns that all this while Arista has actually been secretly envious of Ariel's adventures. After all, Ariel gets to do amazing things on a near-daily basis, and although Arista is not quite as outgoing as Ariel, it would be nice to do something amazing once in a while. Brought closer by this admission, the two sisters put their heads together setting up traps for the Gators, so we end up with Home Alone in Atlantica.

description: Ariel looks for the perfect Father's Day gift to give King Triton, but it leads her to misfortune when a giant octopus traps them in a cave!
tags: ['two word title', "father's day", 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure']
synopsis_with_character_names:
This episode showcases how Urchin has unintentionally wormed his way into Ariel's family. We see him hanging out with King Triton, the father Urchin never knew, and then later sneaking off to Ariel's sisters' dressing room to play a few pranks on the unsuspecting mermaids.

Central to the episode is that Father's Day is close at hand in Atlantica. While Flounder's perfectly happy to get his father ordinary fin warmers, Ariel wants to get her father something special. Urchin, being an orphan, is a little glum in the face of Ariel's enthusiasm until she suggests that he get something for King Triton, since they have been bonding quite a bit in recent times.

So in their quest for the perfect Father's Day gift, the gang meet Moray the Eel, a mer-street vendor. He sells them a map to Shark Canyon where they'll be able to get rare glow shells, something that Ariel thinks will make the best Father's Day Gift ever. Shark Canyon itself doesn't have any sharks, but there is a large squid hanging around and as a result Ariel and Flounder get stuck in a cave. Urchin goes off to get help, but with King Triton being off-duty, Urchin steals borrows the trident, fully intending to return it once he uses it to save Ariel and Flounder.

But as usual, things go wrong. Urchin loses the trident to the sneaky Moray, and so after he frees Ariel and Flounder on his own, the trio go after the Eel, hoping to get back the trident before Triton notices that it's missing. But to their dismay, they discover that Moray has given the trident to the Evil Manta.

On the whole, this is an Urchin episode. He's still the lovable raggamuffin he was when we first met him, but somehow along the way he became a welcome fixture into Ariel's family.

description: Pearl, a mermaid who is obsessed with partying, takes Ariel and her sixth eldest sister, Alana, to Eel-Ectric City instead of to her house, while Sebastian and Flounder follow.
tags: ['hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'classic animation', 'fairy tale fantasy', 'kids family', 'sea adventure']
synopsis_with_character_names:
For all that Ariel gets into adventures and mischief, she's got a pretty good head on her shoulders. In this episode gives in to her baser instincts and ends up doing something classically teenage-girly.

Like every other typical teenhood situation in the movies/on tv, there is one alpha female on the block who decides on what's hot and what's not. In Atlantica, that happens to be Pearl (who first appeared in the episode Red), and whom Ariel admires for her effortless cool... which is kinda understandable, since Ariel is quite the outcast among her merfolk peers.

When Ariel hears her sister Alana is going to a party at Pearl's house, Ariel shyly asks if she can come along. Pearl says yes, Ariel is excited, Alana decides to give her sister a makeover, and Flounder is skeptical about the whole thing (being a boy and all). Ariel and Alana ask their father for permission to go to the party, and it's granted because King Triton feels that it's okay as long as Pearl's parents will be around to supervise the party.

Later when Pearl comes by the palace to pick the two princesses up, she weasels Ariel into driving Triton's chariot to the party. Ariel and Alana are helpless to deny Pearl what she wants, and off they go. But then it turns out that there is no party at Pearl's house, and Pearl is in fact taking them to Eel-ectric City, the place so hoppin' that it's always boppin'. Flounder finds out about this and recruits Sebastian, so that together they can go after and rescue Ariel, though when they arrive things don't quite work out in the way they planned.

It's a lighthearted and modern episode in that sense that it pays homage to the typical teen drama where the unpopular girl wants to be popular and learns that it isn't all that it's cracked up to be. I like that despite all of Ariel's willingness to rebel and push her father's rules, there are some things that make even her uncomfortable, because they're just not worth it. Also, you'd think that this episode would end with Triton scolding his daughters, wouldn't you? Heheh.

description: Two cousins, Ryan Dallion and Micki Foster, inherit an antiques shop from their uncle. Together with his partner, they must track down cursed objects that their devil-worshiping uncle had created. The first object is a demonic killer doll.
tags: ['loneliness', 'antique shop owner', 'antique shop', 'two word episode title', 'cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'sacrifice', 'human sacrifice', 'cursed object', 'fiance fiancee relationship', 'cousin cousin relationship', 'uncle niece relationship', 'tv pilot', 'playground', 'hissing', 'telekinesis', 'inheritance', 'killer child', 'evil girl', 'strangled', 'hospital', 'manipulative', 'stepdaughter murders stepmother', 'told to kill', 'tough love', 'falling down stairs', 'backstory', 'stepmother stepdaughter fight', 'stepmother stepdaughter relationship', 'disturbed child', 'evil doll', 'uncle nephew relationship', 'dead brother', 'possessed doll', 'living doll', 'killer doll', 'demonic doll', 'little girl', 'renege', 'deal with the devil', "in over one's head"]
synopsis_with_character_names:
Night at an antique store, Lewis Vendredi Antique. A couple, the Simms, and their young daughter Mary come in as Lewis goes through his manifest. He tells the couple that they're closed, and Mrs. Irene Simms points out the sign out front says that the store is open. Lewis agrees to stay open, and the Simms look around and Irene tells Mary not to touch anything. Mary does anyway, and Lewis tells her to stop. The girl ignores him and Lewis warns her that the things are not to be played with.

Irene hears them talking and comes over to remind Mary what she said. When Mr. Simms tells Mary to listen to her mother, Mary says that Irene isn't her mother and her real mother is dead. Irene takes offense, and Mr. Simms tells his step wife to leave Mary alone. Lewis goes upstairs, and Mary spots an antique female doll on a shelf. Smiling, the girl picks it up, looks at her parents, and then runs outside with it. She goes to a nearby garage where two boys are working on a car, to get out of the rain.

Mary pulls the string on the back of the doll, and it laughs. The doll talks, saying her name is Vita, and says that the two of them can do a lot of things and they're going to be best friends. The two boys come over and ask Mary where her parents are, and Mary tells the boys to leave them alone. Mary tells them to go away, and Vita tells her that she can have anything she wants. Vita then lunges at one of the boys, scratches his throat with one hand, and Mary runs off with Vita.

When Mary come back into the store, and her parents fuss over her. Mary says that Vita did it. Lewis takes the doll and insists that it's not for sale, and nothing in the store is for sale. He orders the Simms out, and they quickly leave. Once Lewis is alone, he mutters "no more", puts Vita in a bag, along with some of the other antiques, and goes down to a vault in the basement. He puts the antique into it, and above, the windows in the store open apparently on their own.

Lewis quickly finishes putting the antique away, while a wind blows through \the store above. Sealing the vault, Lewis sees flaming hoof prints on the stairs and demonic laughter. He screams in terror and runs to the freight elevator. The antiques in the vault move on their own, and they fly out of the vault doors as they open on their own and fly at Lewis. A cross hovers before Lewis, and when he grabs it, it burns his hand. The elevator door opens, and after Lewis stumbles backward into the elevator, the door closes behind him and the elevator ascends.

A demonic sign burns itself into the wooden floor of the elevator, and the fire consumes the floor revealing a bottomless shaft. Lewis grabs the sides of the elevator, but the metal mesh sparks, breaking his grip so he plummets down the shaft to Hell.

Six months later, Michelle "Micki" Foster tells her fiancé Lloyd that she has to go. Lloyd isn't happy that she's going when his law firm company picnic is coming up, and Micki assures Lloyd that she'll be back. He says that he plans to announce their engagement and it would "behoove" her to be there. Micki takes offense at his tone, and Lloyd apologizes and says that he wishes she'd get the antique store over with. She says that she wants to as well, and doesn't know why her Uncle Lewis left her the store because she hadn't met him or the cousin, Ryan Dallion, that she's sharing everything with. Lloyd figures that he can sue Ryan for a greater share of the inheritance and get some litigation experience.

Micki takes a taxi to the store and notices that the front door is open. She goes inside and calls to anyone there, but gets no response. Ryan jumps out from behind a counter, wearing an antique mask, and startling Micki. She hits him over the head with an antique and he removes the mask. Micki realizes who he is, and explains that Lewis' lawyer told her Ryan would be there, and introduces herself. Ryan says that he thought the telegram said "Michael", and he was expecting a man. He's looking forward to cleaning the place up, but Micki isn't impressed with it. She goes to call Lloyd and tell her that she arrived safely, and discovers the phone are out until the next day.

Ryan looks around and admires the antiques, and figures Lewis was his kind of guy. He says that the lawyer said the store was in probate and they got it by default. They look around and find Lewis' antique limo, and invites Micki to get into the backseat while he checks it out. A cat jumps onto the back seat, startling Micki, and she goes back into the store.

Micki finds her way to the basement and Ryan follows her, saying that it was just a cat. She wants to get an appraisal on the property, and Ryan finds the broken wall and the vault doors beyond. He points out that whatever is behind the doors belongs to them, and pries the door open. Inside are all the antiques Lewis stored there, and the cousins go in, Ryan propping the door open with a metal piece. Mick says that something doesn't feel right about it, and they hear something behind them. Ryan goes to check it out, and the metal propping the doors open bends and shifts so that the door close.

Micki yells in panic, figuring Ryan is playing another prank. Ryan tries to get the door open, and Vita on the shelf comes to "life". Micki sees it and backs away. Antiques fall off the shelf toward her. She finally gets the doors open and runs out, goes to the staircase, and trips. When she grabs a banister, it twists opening a secret compartment in the ceiling. Lewis' manifest drops out and falls onto a couch near the cousins.

Intrigued, Ryan looks through it. Micki complains that she almost suffocated and starts to describe how the doll moved, but then figures Ryan wouldn't believe her. Ryan dismiss her as a "tight ass", and Micki throws antiques at him in anger. He stops her and figures that she doesn't want to run the store with him. Micki tells him that she came there to sell the place. She points out that they didn't even know Lewis, and Ryan says that they're not selling.

The cousins are soon selling, holding a going-out-of-business sale. Ryan concedes that Micki might have been right, and he never wanted to run a business. Mr. Simms is among the people that comes in, and buys Vita for Mary. Micki refuses to sell it, recognizing it from the vault, but Ryan overrides her and sells it to Mr. Simms.

That night, the cousins are counting their money and Ryan tells Micki that they should have everything sold. A man, Jack Marshak, sneaks into the store and searches for something. Micki and Ryan hear him, and Ryan grabs a pipe. They go after Jack, who has moved upstairs, and Jack grabs a sword and tells Ryan to drop his improvised weapon. Ryan does so and Jack demands to know who they are. When Ryan asks who he is, Jack says that he supplies the store with antiques and Lewis didn't always pay his invoices.

The cousins explain that Lewis was their uncle, and Jack is unaware that Lewis is dead until they tell him. They have coffee in the kitchen, and Jack says that he and Lewis were boyhood friends. Jack opens Lewis's eyes to the spirit world, and warns that they may not want to believe in it. He says that Lewis was afraid of growing old, and was greedy, and he dabbled in things that Jack wanted no part of. Jack says that Lewis was involved in devil worship, and he was ready to make a pact with the Devil involving his antiques. In return, Lewis would get immense wealth and immortality. Jack admits that he must not have succeeded if Lewis died, and they'll never know what really happened. He wonders if Lewis left a record of what happened to his antiques, and Ryan shows him the manifest.

When Jack sees the manifest, he confirms that the runes on it are black magic. Jack finds another of Lewis' secret compartments, and it contains finds files on various antiques. The antiques are all in the manifest, and were all connected to mysterious deaths. Micki doesn't believe in any of it, and Jack suggests that Lewis tried to get out of the pact and the Devil killed him. The antique remained cursed, including the ones that the cousins sold. Micki figures that Vita was cursed, and describes how it looked at her like it was alive.

At the Simms home, Mr. Simms gives Mary the doll. He tells her not to let Irene know about it, and Mary agrees. Once they're alone, Vita tells Mary that they can do everything. Downstairs, the husband and wife argue and Vita tells Mary that they can do anything they want with Irene.

Irene finds the wrapping from the present and tells her husband that Mary doesn't deserve one. His wife says that Mary is spoiled, and Mr. Simms says that he tried to make up for the fact that Mary lost her mother. Irene says that she'll take Vita away from Mary, and Mary hears her.

Ryan and Micki find the check Mr. Simms used to pay for Vita, and they go to get it while Jack is going to consult with a medium for more information. He says that the cousins can go home and forget it all happened, but Micki figures that if there's the slightest chance Jack is right, a little girl has the doll and they need to get it back.

In her room, Mary has a tea party with Vita and her other dolls. Vita points out that Irene is mean to Mary, and plays on Mary's hatred of Irene to "punish" her stepmother. Mary hesitantly asks what they should do, but Vita goes silent when Irene comes in. The girl refuses to talk to her because she's having a tea party with her friends, and Irene says that she doesn't hate her but doesn't like how she's been acting. She points out that Mary left her bicycle on the driveway again, and she's taking away her new doll as punishment but can have her back in a week. Mary says that Irene will never take Vita from her and runs away with the doll.

Irene chases Mary to the edge of stairs, takes Vita, and orders Mary into her room. Once Mary goes, Irene puts the doll into a hallway closet. Mary watches from her bedroom door, and Irene goes down the stairs.

Ryan and Micki drive to the Simms' address

Mary gets Vita from the closet, and Irene comes up and sees her stepdaughter with the doll. She tells Mary to give her the doll, and Vita looks at Mary. A skate rolls over under the doll's control, moving behind Irene. Mary then holds Vita out at Irene, and Vita hisses at Irene. Irene steps backward, trips on the skate, and falls down the stairs. Mary looks at her unconscious stepmother, then walks outside after the paramedics arrive to take Irene to the hospital.

Ryan and Micki arrive and figure that they're too late. A neighbor woman tells them what happened, and the cousins see Mary sitting on the curb with Vita. They go over to get the doll, and Mary tells them to go away and Vita hisses at them. Mary then gets into the ambulance with her father, and it leaves for the hospital.

At the hospital, Irene wakes up and Mr. Simms tells her where she is. Mary is in the room with Vita, and Mr. Simms goes to call a doctor. Vita tells Mary to kill Irene, and Mary holds Vita up to Irene, who stares in horror. The girl holds Vita up to Irene's face and Irene dies, gasping in terror. Mr. Simms comes back and breaks into tears, while Mary sits down, plays with Vita, and laughs.

Micki and Ryan arrive at the hospital the next morning, claiming to be Mary's niece and nephew, and the nurse at reception tells them that Irene passed away from a cardiac arrest. Micki worries that someone else might be in danger just like Irene.

The neighbor woman comes over at Mr. Simm's invitation to babysit Mary while he takes care of the funeral arrangements. He worries about Mary since she's lost two mothers.

Mary is playing in her basement play room with Vita and her stuffed animals. The babysitter is sitting in the room and hears Mary. Mary puts a record on and tells Vita that she's having fun just like Vita said, and tells the babysitter that they want more chocolate chip cookies. When the babysitter refuses, saying Mary has eaten too many, Mary demands the cookies and yanks the package away from the women. The babysitter says that it might be good if Mary takes a nap, but Mary refuses and tells her to go away and get out of their house. Vita tells Mary that she knows what to do, and the nearby records fly through the air at the babysitter, under Vita's demonic control.

Micki and Ryan comes to the house, Micki figures that it's their responsibility to deal with the doll.

Vita animates the stuffed animals, which move at the babysitter. A jump rope animates and wraps around the babysitter's neck, and Ryan and Micki at the front door hear her scream and pound on the door. Mary leaves out the patio door with Vita, while Ryan picks the lock on the door. Meanwhile, a bookshelf falls on the babysitter .Everything magically restores itself before the cousins arrive, and they confirm that the babysitter is still alive.

Ryan calls an ambulance on the room's phone, and Micki sees Mary on a swing at a nearby playground. She points the girl out to Ryan and goes after her, and Mary figures that Micki is there to take vita away. Micki says that she has to, and Mary walks away. She holds the doll up and the swings jump at Micki. Micki breaks free of them, and Mary climbs up a slide. Mary holds the doll up, and a clown head on a nearby set breathes fire, and a tetherball swings on its own into Micki.

Mary slides down the slide and goes to a nearby roundabout. Micki follows her and tells her to give her the doll. The roundabout spins on its own, and Micki grabs a railing and gets on as storm clouds gather. Micki tries to get to Mary, and the roundabout speeds up. Ryan arrives and tells Mick not to let go of the railing, and he jumps on the roundabout and manages to pull Vita away from Mary. Mary falls off the roundabout, and it stops spinning as the storm clouds disappear. They go to the bruised Mary, and Micki hugs her and says she'll be okay as they take the girl back to the house.

That night, Jack puts the doll back in the vault and seals the doors. He says that once the antiques were cursed, they can't be destroyed, so they have to be sealed in the vault to keep anyone else from getting them. Micki wonders what will happen to Mary, and Ryan figures that a good shrink can fix her up in 20 years.

Micki calls Lloyd and says that they'll have to postpone the wedding while she deals with Lewis business affairs. Lloyd isn't happy and hangs up. Ryan suggests they change the name of the store, and Jack suggests "Curious Goods". Micki figures they need to get all of the antiques back, the ones that Lewis sold and they sold. When she wonders where they begin, Jack finds an article in a newspaper.

description: Ryan and Micki disguise themselves as monks to retrieve a mysterious pen kept in an ancient monastery.
tags: ['cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'human sacrifice', 'sacrifice', 'cursed object']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At the Eternal Brotherhood Monastery, Abbot Capilano says that they won't sell the monastery no matter what the price offered. Brother Albert La Croix suggests that they could do a lot of good with the money, but then says that he'll support whatever decision Capilano makes. Capilano says that the decision is anonymous and adjourns the meeting.

Capilano goes up to the roof to send a message by pigeon to the Brotherhood headquarters, announcing the decision. Meanwhile, a hooded monk in his quarters writes that Capilano's heart is filled with joy as he sends the message. The monk writes of how Capilano dreams of flight, and Capilano levitates off the roof. He drifts out over the courtyard, and the writer says that Capilano will be deluded. The abbot abruptly plummets to his death many stories below, and the writer closes his book after writing that one more obstacle has been removed from his control of the monastery.

At Curious Goods, Ryan reads a newspaper article about the "Oracle of Death", Brother Currie. A monk claims that he can predict eight deaths, a fire, and an airplane crash. Micki is skeptical, but Jack overhears and describes the story of Nostradamus. Micki isn't convinced, figures that the Oracle of Death is a hoax. Jack sees in the article that the monk uses a quill pen, and says that he picked up the antique quill pen himself. Jack confirms that a quill pen is listed in the manifest. It was sold to Rupert Seldon, and Jack warns that the Eternal Brotherhood is like a fortress and it's a cloistered monastery so it's incommunicado. Jack figures he can forge a letter of introduction, but warns that Micki won't be allowed because women aren't permitted there.

Ryan binds up Micki's breasts and she puts on a monk's robe along with Ryan. Jack finishes the forged letter, and tells Ryan and Micki that their Brothers Matthew and Simon, being transferred in from a monastery in Yorkshire. They go to the monastery and Brother Drake shows them to their quarters. As they go, Drake points out where Capilano "accidentally" fell to his death. Ryan says that Micki has taken a vow of silence so she won't give away by her voice that she's a woman, and Ryan turns the conversation to Currie. Drake says that Currie predicted Capilano's death, and Currie is in seclusion and meets with no one.

Drake takes them to their room, and explains that since space is cramped, they'll be sharing the same room. He directs them to the communal lavatory and showers, and Ryan quickly excuses Drake. Micki isn't impressed with the monks' "generosity", and refuses to take a communal shower. Ryan says that they'll find Currie, grab the pen, and leave.

That night, the brothers gather for communion. Drake points out Ryan to La Croix, saying that he was asking questions about Currie. La Croix suspects they might be journalists and says to keep an eye on them. Afterward, Micki and Ryan go back to their room and go to the mess hall to find Currie. Drake secretly follows them, while they follow a monk taking a tray of food to Currie in a basement cloister. The monk follows them through a chamber filled with a guillotine, and the monk leaves the tray of food at a door and leaves. Currie comes out, and Ryan asks to talk to him about the quill pen. Drake comes up behind them and says that Currie has taken a vow of silence, and he'll escort them back to their quarters.

The next morning, Drake has Ryan and Micki tend to the yard. Brother Arrupe runs past, and Ryan flag him down. Arrupe says that the Oracle of Death has made another pronouncement, that the abbot is going to choke to death. Ryan points out that the abbot died two days ago, and Arrupe wonders if their concern has been misplaced.

That night, Ryan and Mick return to their room. Meanwhile, Arrupe is in his room and receives a message that he's been appointed abbot. He goes to bed, and the canopy on his canopy bed comes down. The blankets pin Arrupe to the mattress, and the cloth canopy smothers him. Arrupe rips a hole in the cloth, and Micki, Ryan, and the other monks hear his screams. They run to his quarters and find Arrupe dead. Ryan and Micki find the message saying that Arrupe had been declared abbot.

The next day, La Croix calls Ryan and Micki to his office. He asks who they are, and Ryan sticks to his cover story. La Croix asks why they were searching for Currie. When Ryan says that they just want to see him, La Croix says that's impossible because Currie wants to be left alone with his burden.

The cousins go back to work on the lawn, and Micki complains about the burden of hunting down the antiques. Ryan doesn't see the problem, and says that it's up to them to get the antiques because no one else is going to do it, and no one will ever believe it.

At Curious Goods, Jack makes a fake quill pen.

Drake introduces Ryan to Brother Jack, a transfer like Ryan. It's Jack, and once Drake leaves, Micki joins them. Jack says that he got photos of the pen from a collector, and made the duplicate. Micki shrieks when she finds a spider, and La Croix and Drake are watching from a distance and notice. Jack says that Seldon is wanted for the murder of his business partner and disappeared afterward.

La Croix--Seldon--visits Currie, who knows that the newcomers know about the pen's problems. He wants to stop using the pen, but La Croix figures that they need to write a new epitaph. He points out that Currie would be behind bars if not for his deal with La Croix, but Currie figures that prison wouldn't be any worse. He asks La Croix to stop torturing him, and La Croix lights a cigar and chuckles, saying that splitting a $500,000 advance on the biography of the Oracle isn't torture. La Croix says that he needs Currie to take credit for what he writes. When Currie says that La Croix is despicable, La Croix says that they both are. When he's abbot, he can sell the monastery and they'll pocket $10 million from the sale. Currie says that it's over and he's leaving, saying that the Oracle has made his last prediction.

Once Currie leaves, La Croix goes to his diary and makes a new entry with the pen. Currie hides beneath the guillotine to avoid some passing monks, and La Croix writes about him committing suicide by the guillotine. Currie is forced to climb onto the guillotine. Meanwhile, Micki and Ryan go to Currie's cell and find it empty. They hear Currie moaning in terror as he straps himself to the guillotine, and run over just as Currie is forced to release the blade.

La Croix runs out and joins them, and says that Currie predicted his own death.

Back in their room, Micki figures that it's the end of things. Ryan points out that they still have to find the pen. Micki says that she's scared, and Ryan admits that he's terrified.

La Croix makes another entry with the pen, describing how Micki and Ryan will be bit by a poisonous spider. A tarantula crawls into the cousins' room and onto the sleeping Micki. She wakes up and sees the tarantula, and calls to Ryan. Ryan tells her to freeze and knocks the spider off, and Jack comes in. Micki points out the tarantula to him, and Jack casually picks it up and says that it's harmless.

The next day while they're working, Micki tells Ryan and Jack that she has to get out. Jack says that there will always be an element of danger, and that's why he's there. Meanwhile, La Croix and Drake are out walking, and La Croix tells Drake that Currie left behind a number of predictions. He's surprised to see the cousins alive, and asks them if there any interruptions with pests. Jack says that there wasn't, and once La Croix leaves, and Jack figures La Croix was fishing for information and that the cousins were supposed to die. Since they're not who La Croix believes that they are, the pen didn't work on them.

La Croix tells Drake to meet with the reporters at the front gate, who are asking about Currie. He also tells Drake to find out if the Yorkshire monastery sent the two new monks. He figures that "Matthew" and "Simon" aren't who they claim to be.

Ryan points out that there was no diary in Currie's cell, or they would have seen it when they searched the place. They figure La Croix has the pen, and Jack says that he can search it while Drake suspects Miki and Ryan.

At the front gate, Drake gives a prepared statement that Currie killed himself because of the burden of his fatal predictions. Micki and Ryan watch La Croix, who is quietly reading a book on the lawn.

Jack searches La Croix's office and finds the diary. He matches the signature on the invoice from the shop for Seldon, with La Croix's writing in the diary. Jack finds Ryan and Micki outside, and tells them what he's found. Drake overhears them talking about going back to La Croix's office to continue the search during the next meditation.

Micki takes a shower while Ryan stands guard outside. Drake sees her through a peephole and realizes that she's an imposter. He goes to La Croix and tells him that the real Matthew and Simon never left the Yorkshire monastery, and they were both bitten by poisonous tarantulas and died. He tells La Croix that "Simon" is a she and offers to have them removed. La Croix stops him, telling Drake to act like nothing has changed. He has Drake start the meditation without him and leaves.

Jack goes back to La Croix's office and searches it. He's looking under a table and when La Croix comes in, Jack claims that he saw a mouse. La Croix draws a gun on Jack, takes him down to the guillotine, and ties it to him. Jack calls La Croix by his real name and figures his upcoming meeting is about real estate. La Croix admits that he has the pen, and puts a burning candle beneath the blade rope.

Ryan and Micki are at meditation, and an impatient Micki finally gets up and tells Ryan that she's going to look for the pen while he look for Jack. She has the fake pen with her.

Real estate agent Marvin Green meets with La Croix to finalize the sale of the monastery. Drake is listening at the door as Green and La Croix discuss the sale. Green offers to reduce his commission to 10%, and La Croix chuckles and says that the commission is normally 3.5%. He demands cash and a percentage, and Green agrees. La Croix excuses himself and leaves with Green in tow, and Micki slips into La Croix's office.

Jack tries to blow the candle out without success.

Micki finds the pen in a hidden compartment in La Croix's chair, and substitutes the duplicate for it. La Croix returns to his office and Micki hides, and he discovers that the diary is gone. He leaves, unaware that he has the duplicate, and Micki quickly leaves as well.

Ryan finds Jack and frees him just in time as the rope burns through. Micki joins them and says that she found the pen. La Croix comes out, gun drawn, and has them hand over the pen. He finds the invoice Jack brought and blindly writes down their epitaph, making sure to say that they're imposters. Drake charges out, swings at La Croix, and misses. La Croix trains the gun on Drake as well, and Drake accuses him of being a traitor. Drake drops the axe and La Croix continues writing on the invoice, saying that a tragedy will be fall the imposters.

Finishing, La Croix realizes that the rope has dropped off the guillotine blade. Jack tells him that he should never write on what he's already signed, and the blade levitates toward La Croix. It flies at La Croix, just missing him several times, and finally embeds itself in a wall. La Croix chuckles in triumph, circles back, and prepares to shoot the trio and Drake. The blade pulls itself free and Micki calls a warning, but La Croix figures that it's a trick. Slamming into his back, the blade kills La Croix and he falls to the floor. Ryan takes the pen.

Later back at Curious Goods, Jack explains that the pen can only make evil predictions come true. Micki has changed back into a dress, and Jack explains that the pen Ryan is holding is the fake. Ryan uses it to write a prediction for lunch, and Micki and Jack stop him.

description: Micki, Ryan and Jack must track down an evil statue that causes men to kill the women they love.
tags: ["close up of a woman's mouth", 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'sacrifice', 'human sacrifice', 'cursed object']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At a bar, Gerald Hastings comes in and puts an antique statue of a horrific-faced Cupid in a bag on a bar top. He tries to make eye contact with a woman, who sees him and tries to avoid him.
