Hastings goes over anyway and asks the woman to dance. She refuses and the man with her tells Hastings that the woman isn't interested. When Hastings persists, the woman angrily tells him that she doesn't want to dance with him and goes to the dance floor with the other man.

Hastings goes back to the bar and removes the bag from the Cupid statue. It comes to life and fires a magical arrow into the girl's arm. Hastings goes over and cuts in, and the woman agrees. She suggests they find a motel room, and Hastings agrees. As they go, Hastings grabs the Cupid statue. They go to the honeymoon suite of a nearby motel and start kissing on the bed. The Cupid statue, placed on a counter top, looks on. After sex, the woman says that it's crazy and she's never experienced anything like it before. She tells Hastings that she love and he strangles her to death.

Frat boys from the bar break in and stop Hastings. One of them, Bowser, sees the Cupid and takes it while his friends pry Hastings off of the dead woman. Ryan reads more of the article, in which Hastings said that he had to kill for Cupid.

The next day at Curious Goods, Micki reads a story about the murder and the Cupid. She asks Jack what she remembers about the Cupid in Lewis' manifest, and he remembers picking it up in Cairo. The maker was so ugly that no woman could look at him, so he vowed vengeance and had the Cupid cast in his image.

Ryan reads more of the article, which talks about how Hastings said he had to kill for Cupid's sake. Micki identifies the Cupid from the manifest, and Lewis sold it to a Frederick Mason four years ago. Jack confirms that Frederick killed three women and was sentenced to death.

Ryan and Micki go to the motel posing as policemen, and the manager says that he saw the Cupid when they barged in but now it's disappeared. The manager says that the frat boys came by and they knocked the door down, and remembers that one of them picked up the statue. They all wore the same t-shirt with the fraternity name on it, but he couldn't read the Greek letters. They all had a symbol of a heart with an arrow through it on the t-shirts.

At the nearby college, Eddie Monroe is taking photographs of Laurie Warren. A campus security guard asks Eddie what he's doing, and Eddie claims that he's taking photos of birds. Eddie approaches Laurie and says that he's been calling her. He thought they could go out again, and Laurie says that she helped him with his homework and it wasn't a date. Eddie accuses her of thinking she's too good for him, and a terrified Laurie says she doesn't think that and tries to walk away. He follows her and asks if he isn't good enough for her, and Laurie doesn't want to talk about it. When Eddie grabs her by the shoulders, Laurie tells him that if she reports him again, he'll be kicked out of college again.

Ryan and Micki arrive, posing as cops and ask about the fraternities. Eddie confirms the fraternity is Delta Lambda Chi from the heart-and-arrow symbol the cousins describe. He shows he's wearing a similar t-shirt and says that he's a member, and Laurie offers to take them there as an excuse to get away from Eddie. Eddie offers them a ride in his truck, but Laurie says it's not far and Micki says that they'll walk. As Laurie leads them away, she tells Micki that she's glad they interrupted.

Eddie drives to the frat house and starts picking up papers. The president of the fraternity, Harold, tells him to do a good job because they're having a party that night, and he lets Eddie wear one of their shirts but he's not a member.

Cleaning up the rooms, Eddie finds the Cupid. Bowser comes in, and Eddie claims that he's dusting. Once Bowser leaves, Eddie looks at the statue.

When Micki and Ryan arrive at the frat house, Ryan figures they'll hand over the statue since one of them took evidence from a crime scene. The cousins go in and Bowser tells Micki that she's invited to the party. Pp asks why they're there, and Ryan says that they're there on official business and are going to look around. When Harold asks for official ID, Ryan says that it's a personal matter and they're not cops.

Micki leads Ryan out, and they spot Eddie bagging garbage. They ask if he saw the Cupid, and Eddie claims that he didn't. The cousins leave, and Ryan tells Micki that she's going to accept the invitation so they can attend the party. That night in a college boiler room, Eddie sits in his quarters looking at the photos of Lauren that he's taken. He also has the Cupid, and cuts out the head of Laurie from the photos and laughs manically.

At the store, Micki and Ryan talk over the situation with Jack. He says that he has what they need to find the Cupid without searching the fraternity.

At the fraternity party, Jack poses as a bartender. He mixes in an old Scottish "truth serum" with the punch, and tells Micki and Ryan that it's sodium pentothal. Meanwhile, Eddie takes photos of Lauren with a male student before they go into the party. When Eddie tries to go into the party, Harold intercept shim and reminds Eddie of what he said earlier. Eddie walks off and drives to a bar, taking the Cupid with him. He tries to hit on a red head, who ignores him.

Ryan and Micki search the fraternity for the Cupid but find nothing. Meanwhile, Bowser drinks at the bar and Jack asks him if he's seen the Cupid. Under the influence, Bowser says that he's got it as Micki and Ryan come over. He takes the cousins to his room to show them, but discovers that it's gone. Bowser figures that Eddie took it when he was cleaning, and he caught Eddie looking at it earlier. Ryan says that they'll try to get it from Eddie, gets Eddie's address from Bowser, and the cousins leave.

At the bar, Eddie puts the Cupid on the bar top. The red head Eddie was hitting on says that it's ugly. Eddie asks the red head for a light, and the Cupid shoots her. She then says that she has a light. Eddie invites her to come for a ride with him, and the red head immediately agrees. They drive off in Eddie's truck.

Ryan and Micki go to the boiler room, avoid a trip wire Eddie left, and search Eddie's quarters.

Eddie parks in some woods, and he and the red head make out. After sex, the red head tells Eddie that she loves him. Eddie take a bottle of honey out of the glove compartment, says it gives him energy, and puts some on the red head's lips and fingers. He then excuses himself to urinate and leaves the cab. Eddie tells her to lock the doors for safety and walks off.

Micki and Ryan search Eddie's quarters, and find the photos of him and Laurie that he pasted together from separate photos. Ryan figures that Eddie has a serious problem.

Eddie finds a beehive, goes back to his truck, and puts it in the front seat. The bees attack the honey-covered red head, stinging her to death. The Cupid watches in satisfaction from the truck bed, and the red head can't get out of the cab because Eddie has parked to block the opposing door, and is keeping the passenger-side door closed. Eddie watches through the window and laughs mockingly as the red head dies.

Micki and Ryan return to the fraternity, and find the drug-influenced Harold talking to Jack about his divorced father. The cousins draw Jack aside and tell him that Eddie has the Cupid and he's dangerous. Jack goes to look for Eddie while the cousins look for Eddie. One fraternity brother says Eddie might have gone to the motel bar nearby because he couldn't get a drink at the party. Jack excuses himself and heads to the motel bar.

The obsessed Eddie drives to Laurie's house.

At the motel bar, Jack talks to the bartender who says that another guy was looking for Eddie. The bartender says Eddie left with the red head but doesn't know how Eddie did it. The bartender overhead that Eddie was taking the red head to Mason's Creek, and Jack heads there.

Ryan and Micki confirm with Harold that Jack left.

Jack drives to Mason's Creek and searches around. He find the red head's bee stung corpse dumped in the woods, and Bowser shows up. He recognizes Jack from the party, and says he came to recover the Cupid that Eddie stole from him.

Laurie's boyfriend Alex leaves her sitting beneath a tree, to get some beer. Eddie comes up behind Laurie, puts the Cupid on the grass, and asks if he can sit down. Laurie refuses, saying she's with someone, and tells Eddie to go away. He show her the Cupid and claims that it's a token of his affection for her.

Micki and Ryan search for Eddie, and spot Eddie walking away arm-in-arm with Eddie. Eddie abandons Laurie and runs into the boiler room, and Ryan goes after him while Micki stays with Laurie. Eddie hides behind a pillar and Ryan runs past him, then climbs up a ladder. Ryan hears him, doubles back, and grabs the Cupid that Eddie is holding, trying to pull it away from Eddie. When he fails, he grabs a pile and hits Eddie. Eddie drops the Cupid, and Ryan grabs it and runs out.

Micki tries to tell Laurie that he's obsessed, but Laurie is under the Cupid's spell and doesn't believe it. Ryan returns with the Cupid. Laurie demands an explanation, and Jack finds them and says that he found the corpse of the red head. Eddie returns and hides in the bushes, overhearing them. The security guard comes over and asks if everything is okay, and says that the frat boys reported the Cupid as stolen. The guard takes it to the security office for safekeeping, and walks away.

The trio figure it will be safe in the security office and drive off with Laurie. Meanwhile, Eddie approaches the guard and says that they bought the Cupid at a swap meet. The guard, thinking Eddie is with the fraternity, gives the Cupid to him.

The trio return to the store with Laurie, and Micki has her stay upstairs in her room with her. Once Micki leaves her alone, she joins the two men. Jack figures they can't tell the police about the Cupid because then they would hold it as evidence. Meanwhile, the still love-smitten Laurie calls Eddie at the boiler room. She says that she had to go with the trio to avoid arousing their suspicions, and Eddie invites her to his place. Laurie agrees and confirms Eddie got the Cupid, and says that she loves him.

Laurie sneaks out and goes to the boiler room. Eddie has set out a candlelit dining table, and comes up behind her holding the Cupid. "Laurie" reveals that she's a wig-wearing Micki, and she says that they overheard Laurie on the phone and realized she was coming to see Eddie. Micki tells Eddie to give her the Cupid, and when Ryan pounds on the door Micki breaks away from Eddie and yells to her cousin. Eddie says that he has to kill Laurie and it might as well be Micki, and he wants Laurie dead because she made fun of him.

Eddie comes after Micki, who runs as Ryan breaks into the boiler room. Using the Cupid statue, Eddie causes Micki to fall in love with him. She tries to protect Eddie, who comes up. Micki embraces him, and Eddie tells Ryan to run along so they can have fun. Eddie is holding a fire axe, and dares Ryan to come at him. He swings and hits a nearby steam pipe, which bursts and sprays steam into Eddie's face. Eddie pushes Micki to the floor and screams in agony, and Ryan shoves him away and goes to Micki, She's knocked unconscious from hitting the floor.

When Eddie runs with the Cupid, Ryan goes after him and chases him through the catwalks in the boiler room. Eddie swings across a gap on a chain hanging from a pulley, and Ryan goes after him the same way. Edging across a pipe with Ryan in pursuit, Eddie slips and falls to his death. Ryan gets Micki, and they both look at Eddie's corpse as Ryan takes the Cupid.

Later at the store, the trio put the Cupid into the vault. They leave and go upstairs, and Laurie thanks them as they escort her out. Ryan hits on Laurie, but she says that she's having someone pick her up. Alex arrives and Laurie leaves with him. Ryan jokingly considers using the Cupid on Laurie to get a little edge, and invites Micki to dinner. She refuses and walks off.

description: A mysterious teacup gives an elderly woman the power of eternal youth -- at a cost.
tags: ['cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'human sacrifice', 'sacrifice', 'cursed object', 'rock concert', 'elder', 'homeless man', 'homelessness', 'rock music', 'strangulation', 'homeless child', 'homeless person', "rock 'n' roll", 'strangled to death', 'murder by strangling', 'strangled', 'rock band', 'homeless woman', 'rock star', 'pickpocket', 'cursed teacup', 'youth restored', 'eternal youth', 'teacup', 'elderly flirting', 'elderly killer', 'elderly romantic interest', 'elderly widow']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A young runaway girl is sleeping on the ground in the park, and a woman approaches her. The runaway wakes up and asks what the woman wants, and the woman sits down next to her and offers her a cup of hot tea. The woman says that she's nobody just like runaway girl, and takes an ivy-covered cup of tea out of a paper bag along with a Thermos. She pours some tea and offers it to the runaway, and the runaway drinks from it. The ivy on the tea cup comes to life, grows, and strangles the runaway, then retracts back onto the cup.

Later, Lady Die is singing in a recording booth. The sound board operator, Teddy, puts in a new path and Die stops the recording to complain and tells Teddy not to surprise her again. She storms off to her dressing room, and her agent Langley follows her in and shows her PR shots while Die checks her face in her mirror. She complains about looking too old in one photo and picks another one, and asks about the benefit concert she's doing in a few nights. Die doesn't want to look chintzy on her first benefit, and Langley asks her why she's doing it for the homeless. The singer doesn't give an explanation, and Langley quickly apologizes for giving an opinion she disagrees with.

Teddy comes in and tells Die that they're ready for her. She goes back to the recording studio and starts singing.

Later at the store, Ryan is listening to Die's record on his stereo. Micki comes in with groceries and Ryan shows off his record collection to her. She turns down the volume, and a social worker, Birdie, comes in with their curtains that she's been working on to spruce up the place. Jack is working nearby and tells her that she shouldn't have, but Birdie insists. She tries to flirt with Jack, who is busy working on a protein drink and isn't interested. Ryan and Micki pick up on Birdie's interest and go under to run interference between Jack and Birdie.

Jack is working on rats and says that his drink tends to have a mild aphrodisiac effect. Birdie offers to volunteer, Jack hastily dismisses her offer while thanking her, and Micki leads Birdie off for some coffee. Birdie says that there was another murder in the park and she had to identify the body. The runaway had no family or friends, and wasn't the first similar murder. Jack and Micki remember and case earlier that year about a woman, Sarah Berell, and Birdie points out that Sarah disappear but wasn't strangled. She says that the police don't care and nobody cares about the homeless, and Ryan points out that Die is holding a benefit concert for the homeless. Birdie notes that a concert won't stop the murders.

Micki offers herself and Ryan talking to the police. Birdie figures it won't do any good, but the cousins go to the morgue where a coroner is working on the runaway's body while Lieutenant Fishbein looks on. Micki and Ryan talk to Fishbein about the homeless deaths, passing themselves off as neighborhood watch. Fishbein says that homeless persons make perfect targets for sport, and says that the murderer is a sicko. He says that unless they have an eyewitness, he's unlike to solve the murders. The coroner finds a greenish stain on the corpse's neck, and Ryan grabs a leaf on the clothing. Fishbein tells Micki that the cousins are trespassing and should get the hell out or he'll arrest them.

The cousins take the leaf back to the store, and Jack confirms that it's swapper's ivy from Ireland. It doesn't exist anymore and was considered an evil plant. The user could use the ivy to trade for whatever they wanted, and finds a reference to a tea cup with swapper's ivy design on it in the manifest. It was sold to Fat Eddie Burrell two years ago, and he lives in Hillsdale.

That night, Ryan and Micki go to Fat Eddie's seemingly-abandoned apartment building. The front door is unlocked and they hesitantly go in. The apartment is overgrown with ivy and seemingly abandoned, uneaten food on the table. A murphy's bed with a skeleton on it falls out of its closet.

Die is at the benefit concert stage, having her crew set up the lighting. She checks her face in her compact, and Langley assures her that she looks fine. Die leaves and Langley sees a young girl, Kristen, grabbing food from the crafts table. When Kristen tries to run, Langley grabs her and then gives her a cinnamon bun. Kristen hugs him and leaves, and Langley discovers that Kristen stole his wallet. The girl in some bushes while Langley runs past without seeing her.

The woman approaches a homeless person sitting on a park bench and offers him a cup of tea from the ivy cup. Kristen comes up and asks if she can have some tea, and the woman tells her that it's just for grownups. The girl admires the woman's bracelet, and the woman offers it to her if she leaves. Kristen accepts and goes, and when the homeless man drinks from the cup, the ivy comes to life and strangles him to death as the woman--Die--watches in satisfaction. Kristen witnesses the murder from the darkness.

The next day, Fishbein and his men take the body away after having Birdie try to identify it. Birdie goes over to where Micki and Ryan are waiting, and says that the homeless man isn't one of hers. Ryan goes to get the limo. Kristen is there and asks Birdie for some food, and Micki offers to find her some. Birdie sees Die's bracelet that Kristen is wearing and asks where she got it, and Kristen insists that it's hers. The social worker says that it belonged to Sarah and that Sarah was Fat Eddie's brother. Kristen finally says that the woman who murdered the homeless man gave the bracelet to her, and confirms the woman was much younger than Sarah, who was over 70. The girl describes how the woman she saw was giving the homeless man something to drink in a tea cup, and Micki says that Kristen had better come with her.

Ryan pulls up and Kristen runs. When he comes over to ask Micki and Birdie what was going on, Fishbein notices.

As they drive back, Ryan figures that Kristen is terrified. Birdie says that she'll get them a photo of Sarah from her file. On the radio, the announcer David Kay says that he'll be interviewing Die that night before her benefit concert the next night. Ryan turns the volume up on Die's song, and Micki asks him to turn it down. Birdie smiles and says that Sarah used to sing the nursery rhyme "I'm a Little Teapot", that Die is doing a rock version of.

Later at the store, Ryan "ages" the album cover of Die. Jack says that in the legends, old age was traded for youth. Birdie comes in wearing a mini-skirt as Jack suggests that the ivy trades the victim's life force for the cupholder's age. The social worker shows off her dress and asks what Jack thinks, and suggests they get some meal. Jack begs off and goes back to check on his experiment. Micki tells Birdie that Jack is just shy, but Birdie isn't consoled. She notices Ryan's sketch and says that Sarah had the same problem, then leaves.

Once Birdie leaves, a relieved Jack comes back. Ryan suggests that Die and Sarah are the same person, and Jack suggests that they pay Die a visit. Micki points out that Die is being interviewed live by Kay that night, and Jack offers to print them the proper credentials.

Kristen walks down the street and comes to the radio station, and sees a poster of Die and recognizes her from the murder scene. Ryan and Micki pull up and go in, posing as rock magazine reporters. Meanwhile, Kay is interviewing Die about the concert. She says that she's doing something for the homeless, and he plays a song from her new CD. Langley is there and comments that Die is looking tired. She checks her face in her compact and realizes that her age is catching up to her.

Ryan and Micki come in and flash their fake credentials, Micki posing as Ryan's chauffeur, and say it's about Sarah. Die feigns ignorance, and Langley and Kay call for security. Die runs out the back and bumps into Kirsten, who pickpockets the teacup from her as the rock singer runs off. Birdie is also there and stares at Die in recognition. When Birdie calls her by "Sarah", Die runs the other way.

The guards escort Ryan and Micki out. They both noticed that Die is aging, and figure she went to the park to find a new victim.

In the park, Die approaches a sleeping homeless man and offers him a drink. She discovers that the teacup is gone.

Kristen in an alleyway, singing the nursery rhyme. She makes the motion, then grabs the cup and runs off.

Micki and Ryan search the park looking for Die. Ryan insists that Die is Sarah, and that's why she ran when they mentioned the cup. Micki figures that Die will on killing to stay young, and Ryan points out that they have to stop her before Die gives her concert because after that, she leaves town on her tour.

An aging Die crawls back the way she came, looking for the cup on the ground. Meanwhile, Micki and Ryan spot a woman with white hair, her back to them, and approach her. They grab her but it's not Die and she screams. Ryan apologizes and the cousins continue on.

Birdie searches the park for Die.

Kristen returns to the park with the cup, finds her things where she hid them, and lies on her blanket humming to herself. She dozes off but wakes up when someone approaches her, and runs away holding the cup. It's Micki and Ryan, who catch her and tell Kristen not to worry. Micki offers to give her a real meal, a bed, and another pretty cup for the teacup, and Kristen agrees. They leave and Die watches them from the shadows.

The cousins return to the store with Kirsten and tell Jack that they recovered the cup. They take Kirsten upstairs to the bedrooms, unaware that Birdie followed them. Ryan puts the cup down on a desk before he goes to the kitchen with Jack to make some food for Kirsten, and Micki makes up a bed for Kirsten. Birdie breaks in, grabs the cup, and leaves. The others have gathered in the kitchen, and hear the bell on the door. Birdie hails a taxi and tells the driver to take her to the park.

As Micki tucks Kirsten in, she assures the girl that the store wouldn't be a good place for her to live permanently. Micki assures Kirsten that she can stay there for a while and then they'll find her a good home.

Birdie approaches a sleeping drifter asks him to join her for a nightcap. She talks about how it's lonely no matter where she is, and pours alcohol into the cup. Birdie mutters a toast to happiness and youth, then gives the drifter the cup to drink. As the leaves stares to come to life, Birdie yanks the cup away, tosses it on the ground, and wonders what she's doing. As Birdie cries, the drifter invites her to drink with him and she accepts, drinking from the bottle.

The next day, Ryan says that the thief was apparently old and moved slow. They figure it was Sarah, not Die, and she was aging. They figure that if they don't stop Die, she'll kill again.

In the park, the drifter says he'd better "start his rounds". Birdie thanks him for talking to her, saying that she needed the company, and the drifter tells her that she's cool for an old lady. She says that she doesn't feel like one anymore, and after the drifter leaves Birdie picks up the cup and leaves. Birdie goes to a phone booth and calls the store, unaware that the aged Die is watching her from the nearby bushes. The social worker tells Ryan that she has the cup and would like to return it.

Ryan and the others drive to the park, and Fishbein and his assistant secretly follow them. The trio discover that Birdie is gone and split up to search for her. Meanwhile, Die chases Birdie, who trips on a branch, falls down a slope, and drops the cup. Birdie passes out, and Micki and Ryan find her a few minutes later. Fishbein and his men arrest them arrest them as the killers, and Fishbein confirms that Birdie is still alive. The cousins insist that Die is the murderer, but Fishbein doesn't believe them. Jack watches from hiding and slips away.

The aged Die goes to the phone booth and calls Langley, and tells him not to cancel the show.

Fishbein and his men take Ryan and Micki to a squad car and drive them off, then put Birdie into an ambulance.

In the park, Die finds a sleeping homeless man under a blanket and pours him a cup of tea. She offers it to the man, who is Jack wearing a wig. He dumps the tea out and says that the cup doesn't belong to her and runs off with it. Die collapses to the ground, yelling in frustration.

That night at the concert venue, Langley goes to Die's trailer and calls through the door, saying that her fans want her. Die tells Langley not to come in and she'll be out in a second. Meanwhile, Jack goes to the venue. Micki and Ryan have been freed and are with the recovered Birdie at Die's trailer, plotting to steal the cup from Die. Jack finds them and shows them the cup, and Langley sees them and asks what is going on. The door opens and the now decrepit Die says that it's show time. She then dies of old age and falls onto the ground.

The next day at the store, Jack continues working on the protein drink and removes the aphrodisiac effect. Micki comes downstairs with Kirsten, and Birdie comes in and greets the group. She confirms that Kirsten hasn't changed her mind about moving off the streets and asks if they want to play tea party.

description: On Halloween night, Micki and Ryan are visited by the ghost of their late uncle, who has returned from the underworld.
tags: ['cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'human sacrifice', 'sacrifice', 'cursed object', 'ghost', 'halloween', 'pentacle', 'evil little person', 'mortuary', 'occult ritual', 'reference to the birdman of alcatraz', 'trick or treat', 'wizard costume', 'crystal ball', 'mistress costume', 'halloween party', 'halloween costume']
synopsis_with_character_names:
On Halloween night, Micki is in her room making herself up as a witch. Ryan watches her and the Murphy bed comes down, revealing a dummy of a corpse that Ryan planted. He comes in and jokes with Micki, who is not amused. The "dummy" reveals that he's Ryan's friend, Larry, and Ryan dismisses it as part of Halloween. Micki complains about letting Ryan talking her into having a party at Curious Goods, and Ryan insists that they have to let the neighbors know that the store is nothing to be scared of. Micki wonders how they'll keep track of everything with so many people there, and Ryan assures her that he made a sign that the vault is off-limits.

More guests arrive, and Jack dressed as Merlin performs magic tricks and Tarot card readings. Meanwhile, Larry and his friend Howard ignore the keep out sign and go down to the basement vault. They turn off the lights, scaring the guests, and when they turn the lights back on at the fuse box, it burns out. Continuing on, Larry and Howard find a crystal ball sphere and Howard wants to leave, frightened. Larry jokingly tries to call up Elvis, and the ball changes color. Ryan comes down as they both run for the stairs, and Ryan tells them that the party is upstairs.

The two teenagers go back upstairs, and Ryan gets the lights back on. As he goes back upstairs, he hears something moving in the darkness and goes back to investigate. He finds the ball, now emitting smoke, and runs upstairs. Ryan tells Jack and Micki that they have a problem, and a cold wind blows through the room. A ceiling tile breaks open, and Jack yells at everyone to get out.

Once everyone leaves, the ghostly noises and wind die down. Jack has Ryan draw a pentacle around the desk and gets the crystal ball. He brings it to desk and tells the cousins that Larry and Howard attracted something when they triggered the ball. A pumpkin explodes, and Jack casts a spell to banish the ghosts. Everything quiets down and Ryan asks Micki to come with him to get punch from the kitchen.

Jack hears a tapping at the door and goes to investigate. He finds a girl sitting outside, Greta, and she says that she went out trick-or-treating and got lost. Greta says that she lives nearby, and Jack takes her home.

Ryan and Micki come back and discover that Jack is gone.

Greta continues leading Jack on, insisting her house is just ahead.

Ryan insists that whatever was haunting them before is gone. Meanwhile, the mist from the ball drifts up the stairs and the cousins feel the chill from it.

Jack realizes that Greta is leading her in circles and tells her that her game is over. Greta insists that it's no game and they're almost there, and Jack goes with her.

Ryan and Micki hear a ghostly sighing as the mist drifts into the main room. Lewis' ghost appears and they recognize him from his picture. Lewis says that he didn't come back to hurt them, and he can't even if he wanted to. He says that he knows they have a right to be angry at him, and he's come back to make amends and undo the curse.

Greta tells Jack that her home is down an alley. When he goes in, a gate drops down, trapping him. Greta transforms into her evil self, laughs in triumph, and says that Jack fell for a feeble trick. Jack realizes that Evil Greta is working with Lewis, who is loose upon the earth.

Lewis says that he'll need their help to undo the curse, and he can only stay in the real world until dawn and then he must return to his punishment in Hell. He says that he must undo the murder of his wife, his secret sin, and reveals a hidden doorway behind a bookcase before disappearing. The cousins enter the room beyond and find quarters. Lewis' ghost is standing beside a bed with the corpse of a woman. He says that it's Grace, his wife, and says that he killed her with his ambition and greed. Grace stood in the way of that, and Lewis needs the Amulet of Zohar from the vault. With the amulet, Lewis can fill Grace's soul. If they help him free her soul, Lewis will end the curse. Ryan and Micki agree and go to the vault.

Two men dressed for Halloween drive by, see Jack, park and get out, and come over to mock Jack.

Ryan and Micki get the amulet and Ryan figures they have nothing to lose and Lewis can't even touch them. They return to the hidden room and Lewis has them hold the Amulet next to Grace. The Amulet glows and jumps out of Micki's hand to Lewis', and Lewis turns solid. Ryan grabs Lewis, who easily knocks him aside and runs outside, sealing the door behind them and trapping them in the room. Lewis goes to the limo where Greta is waiting. She confirms that they have three hours until sunrise, and Lewis drives off with her.

The two men taunt Jack, who taunts them as peasants and invites them to come in and get him. They hook a chain up from their truck to the gate.

Micki keeps yelling for help until Ryan tells her to stop because she's giving him a headache. She wonders what Lewis is going to use the Amulet for, and Ryan gets an idea for how they can escape.

The two men pull out the gate enough for Jack to slip free. He then uses flash powder to escape the men.

Ryan and Micki escape through a vent and realize that Lewis is gone. Micki checks the manifest for the Amulet, and discovers that a spirit needs to take over a body to come back to life. The entry is in Old English, and all Micki can make out is that she needs to get into a body that died from a peaceful death. Ryan figures that Lewis is heading to a mortuary and looks for the closest one. They discover that Lewis took the car, and Micki leaves a note for Jack before they leave on foot.

Lewis and Greta pull up to a mortuary, and break in using the power of the Amulet. They look for a suitable corpse, and Ryan and Micki arrive outside, see the car, and realize Lewis is inside. A hearse pulls up, and Lewis and Greta come out. They take casket out and knock out the driver when protests, then take the coffin inside. Meanwhile, Ryan tries to pick the lock on the door and finally gets it open. He and Micki go inside.

Jack gets to the store and finds Micki's note. He takes his magic kit with him and goes to check mortuaries.

Ryan and Micki sneak in and find Lewis and Greta preforming a ritual on the corpse. They retreat down the hallway and consider what to do next. The cousins figure that if they get the Amulet, they'll render Lewis powerless. Ryan plans to go for the Amulet while Micki lures Greta away.

Micki goes into the chamber where Lewis is performing the ritual, says "Sorry", and runs out. Lewis sends Greta after her, and Micki ducks into a room with coffins. Greta soon finds Micki and magically levitates her into the air, then takes her back to Lewis.

Ryan sneaks into the chamber then tries to get the Amulet. Lewis shoves him across the room and Ryan runs out. Greta is there and entrances him, then leads him into a room and has him lie in a coffin. She locks it shut, then locks shut another coffin with an entranced Micki in it. Greta then sets both coffins on a roller belt going into a crematorium furnace and turns it on. Greta then returns to Lewis and tells him that she's giving their guests a "warm welcome".

Jack finds the mortuary and sees the car parked outside. He picks the lock on the door and goes inside.

Lewis continues performing the ritual, and Jack hears him and peers through the door. He then retreats and finds the crematorium, and pulls the coffins off the belt just in time. Jack says that the Amulet is too strong to stop, and all they can do is slow Lewis down until sunrise in eight minutes. He has Micki and Ryan distract Greta, a demon, while Jack slows Lewis down until dawn.

The cousins yell through the chamber door, and Lewis sends Greta after them. Micki and Ryan run off, and Jack goes into the chamber and tells Lewis that he must abide by his choice. Lewis says that he wouldn't have made his choice if he had known the punishment, and in Hell he dies over and over. Jack deflects Lewis' magical attack and says that he can't waste time trying to kill him.

Greta searches for the cousins, who are hiding in a storage vault. They run out and shove gurneys at Greta.

Jack casts spells to negate Lewis' ritual, and the two chant over the corpse.

Greta throw a chair at the cousins, missing and hitting a fuse box. The demon accidentally impales herself on a metal pipe, and she disappears in a flash of smoke. The cousins go to the chamber where Jack is on his knees, weakened. Lewis figures he has two minutes left, but Jack says that the cousins stopped the power and the clock on the wall. Micki opens the window letting the sunlight in, and Lewis is sent back to Hell.

Later back at Curious Goods, the trio clean up the debris from the party. Jack says that Lewis was married to Grace, she died and was buried, and they all lost a great friend. He waxes on about her beauty, and admits that he knew her better than he should have, but not as well as he dearly wished. Micki hopes that someone will talk about her that way, and Jack warns that in two weeks it will be Friday the 13th.

description: Micki and Ryan track down a box used to perform a dangerous magic trick.
tags: ['stage magic', 'escape artist', 'magic contest', 'cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'human sacrifice', 'sacrifice', 'cursed object']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In his dressing room, the magician Fahteem shares a toast with his new assistant, Collette. He secretly drugs her glass of champagne and they share a toast to the assistance she will provide him. As Collette passes out from the drugged drink, his assistant Robert Simpson knocks at the door and says they need Fahteem to go on early because another magician called in sick. Fahteem tells Robert not to interrupt him again and Robert leaves.

Collette is unconscious, and Fahteem tells her farewell. He then goes out on the club stage and performs his finale. He gets into the "Cabinet of Doom", while in his dressing room, Collette sleeps inside of a large cabinet. Meanwhile, Fahteem has said that two people have died accepting his challenge to survive the Cabinet. He has Robert put a dummy in the cabinet, then pulls a lever to drop sword blades into it.

Waking up, Collette yells for help but no one hears her.

Once the blades are pulled back up, the cabinet is opened to reveal the pierced dummy. Fahteem enters the cabinet and his assistant closes the door. Robert then pulls the lever and releases the blades. Collette is skewered while Fahteem is unharmed. Once the swords are pulled up, Fahteem emerges to applause from the audience.

Later, Fahteem is packing up the Cabinet of Death in the empty club. A figure emerges from the shadows and pulls the lever, despite Fahteem's protestations. The swords fall, piercing and killing him.

At Curious Goods, Jack is reading an article about Fahteem's death. He tells Ryan and Micki that Fahteem was one of the world's great magicians, and died in an accident three months ago. Jack explains that magicians were surprised by Fahteem's rise to prominence, and he did an illusion that was so dangerous that few magicians try it: the Cabinet of Doom. The older man explains the illusion, and how no one ever figured it out. Jack says that he used to do the Pendulum of Death, and it required impeccable timing and skill. Fahteem was killed, apparently when the armature with the blades slipped.

Jack mentions Fahteem's real name of Harvey Ringwald, and both he and Micki recognize it from the manifest. They find Ringwald listed as the purchaser of the Houdin Box. Jack explains that the box once belonged to the legendary French magician, Houdin. Houdin died trying to perfect it, and the article mentions that Robert now works for a magical supply house. Jack sends Ryan and Mick to talk to Robert, while he checks with some fellow magicians at the Temple of Magic to see what they know about Fahteem.

When the cousins meet with Robert, Robert says that he hasn't seen Fahteem's things since the accident. Ryan says that it's important they get the Box back, and Robert wonders why. Micki claims that they want it for sentimental reasons, and Robert says that Fahteem didn't have partners but flunkeys, and Fahteem never revealed his secrets to anyone. Last he heard, all of Fahteem's items were auctioned off. Robert says that he should have been the headliner and Fahteem the flunkey.

Once the cousins leave, Robert calls a man and says that someone is asking about the cabinet. He assures the man at the other end that he didn't tell anyone anything, and the man tells Robert to handle Micki and Ryan if they get in the way.

At the Temple of Magic, the staff are preparing for a televised magician's contest. Jack meets with a friend, Monte, who says the winner will get $100,000 and an invitation to the Magic Star Society. Monte tells Jack that Fahteem's equipment has already been dispersed, and only a lunatic like his assistant, Tommy, would try something so dangerous.

Micki and Ryan arrive, and Jack introduces them to Monte. Monte says that it's a closet set but invites them to come back during the next night's contest as his guests. Once Monte leaves, the cousins tell Jack that Fahteem and Robert weren't friends. A magician, Montarro, is berating his daughter Lyla that she has been nothing but a problem since her mother died. Monte comes over and tells Montarro that the auditorium is magicians only. Montarro introduces himself and says that his specialty is a death-defying act, the Coffin of Blood. It's the Cabinet of Doom, with a new paint job.

The trio return to the shop and Jack tells the cousins that whoever has the Houdin Box can be the best magician in the world. He figures they'll try to prove it in Monte's contest, and says that they're looking for something spectacular and death-defying. Micki figures that Montarro is a likely suspect, and Jack figures that they can get in with him as a magician, and the cousins as his assistants.

Jack gets his old magic props out, and later at the Temple tells Monte that he'll be performing the Pendulum of Doom. Monte refuses to let Jack endanger himself, but finally gives. After telling one magician practicing, Miranda, to get her act together, he says that Jack will have to audition like anyone else, and only the top five will qualify for the televised contest. Ryan goes to unload Jack's gear and check out the prop room.

Ran takes the gear into the prop room. He looks around and finds the Coffin of Blood., marked the property of the Great Montarro.

Miranda slips an envelope under the dressing room door of Montarro's dressing room and then leaves.

In his dressing room, Jack practices his escape while Micki times him. He's rusty, and Tommy secretly watches Jack practice. He sees Jack use a hidden key in the straitjacket to unlock the padlock on it and free himself. Micki says that it too Jack 85 seconds to escape when the rope burns in a minute, and Jack assures her it's faster upside down. Ryan comes in and tells them he found the Coffin and it belongs to Montarro. Jack figures that Montarro has his hands on some of Fahteem's equipment and goes to check on it with Montarro.

Later, Micki and Ryan are having drinks in the Temple bar. Montarro is complaining to Lyla about how someone is trying to blackmail him out of jealousy or greed, and tells Lyla to stay out of his business. He insists that it's his chance and he won't be denied.

Jack goes to the prop room to check out the Coffin.

Montarro leaves, and Ryan tells Micki that he'll tail the magician to make sure he doesn't barge in on Jack. Ryan says that Micki should keep an eye on Lyla and leaves. Micki approaches Lyla, who is crying.

Going to the stage, Montarro enters the cabinet there and closes the door behind him. Ryan, following him, opens the doors and discovers that Montarro has vanished.

Lyla thanks Micki for her friendliness, and says that her father is strict and might not let her meet with Micki afterward. She tells Micki that she really loves her father, and Micki invites her to the store. Lyla says that she's been on the road with Montarro since she was 16, and Micki asks her about the Coffin. The woman admits that she doesn't know much about it. Lyla asks why Micki is there, and Micki says that they're trying to win the $100,000 first prize.

Jack measures the Coffin and then hides inside of it when Montarro comes in. Ryan finds Montarro, and Montarro accuses Ryan of following him. He says that Ryan doesn't belong there, and Ryan asks for his autograph. As Montarro signs the piece of paper that Ryan provides, Ryan leans on the level controlling the armature and Jack sees him. As Ryan talks about Fahteem, Montarro finishes signing the autograph and tells him to leave. Jack sighs in relief as Ryan leaves the armature, and Montarro leaves behind him.

Emerging from the Coffin, Jack finds Ryan and Micki. Ryan says that he didn't know Jack was in the Coffin, Micki says that Lyla is terrified of her father and doesn't have a clue how he performs the Coffin, and Jack reports that there's no way out of the Coffin. They figure it's the Box, which explains Montarro's paranoia.

Later, a figure slips into Jack's dressing room and files through the extended part of the key in the straitjacket.

On the stage, Monte complains to Micki and Ryan that Jack hasn't shown up and the audition is in a few minutes. Ryan goes to check the gym and Micki checks Jack's dressing room. When they don't find him, they return to the stage and finds a hooded Jack in the straitjacket. Micki introduces the Pendulum of Death illusion as the assistants rig Jack up above a bed of spikes.

Micki sets the rope suspending Jack on fire. Jack frees one hand and uses the key, but the end breaks off because of the filing. Jack falls to his death on the spikes, and Ryan removes the hood to reveal that it's Tommy. Jack comes out and tells the cousins that Tommy locked him in the closet so he'd have a chance to perform. They check the key and discover it was filed through so that it would break, and realize Tommy's death was no accident. Micki figures that they're getting too close, and that Montarro was too obvious. She suggests that Miranda is the murderer, and she's been watching them closely.

The trio go to Miranda's dressing room and find her dead of hanging, an apparent suicide. Ryan removes "her" wig and they realize that it's Robert. There's no suicide note, and they suspect that Robert didn't kill himself. There's sawdust in the wig, and assistant Tony comes in, see Robert's dead body, and runs. Ryan chases him down, and Tony says that it was Robert's idea to blackmail Montarro. Jack demands answers, and says that it has something to do with the Box. Tony tells them that Robert tried to find out about the illusion from Fahteem, but Fahteem wouldn't tell him anything before his death. They figure Montarro killed Fahteem to get the Box, and Robert and Tony came there to find the Box and write their own ticket. Robert found it but never told Tony where it was, but he did send a note to Montarro to arrange terms so they would be the headliners in exchange for their silence. All Tony knows is that when Fahteem performed his illusion, someone had to be inside the box.

That night a half-hour before the contest begins, the trio figure that whoever using the box is just murdering. Jack goes to Monte to try and get him to postpone the contest, Micki goes to convince Lyla not to perform and stop the performance, while Ryan looks for Montarro figuring he's lining up another victim.

Micki finds Lyla on stage as Montarro checks the Coffin. Lyla says that she and her father are getting along pretty well, and Micki asks her not to help her father perform the Coffin so that he can't go on. She says that it's real magic, and says that Montarro has the Box. Lyla has seen it and takes Micki to see it. It's in the wine cellar, and when Micki gets in to check it, Lyla locks her inside. She boasts that she's the Great Montarro, and she made her father what he is. Lyla says that her father doesn't know what's going on with the Box, and no one is going to get in her way. She thanks Micki for "helping" her with the act, and says that Micki will be at the show in spirit before leaving.

Jack finds Monte backstage and tries to get him to postpone Montarro's act. Monte figures that it's jealousy and Jack says that Tommy was killed in place of him. Jack says that the murderer killed Robert and made it look like suicide, but Monte doesn't believe him. Ryan finds Jack and they both realize that Micki is gone, and go to talk to Lyla. Lyla claims that she hasn't seen Micki for a while and prepares to go on with her father. Ryan sees sawdust on Lyla's back and realizes it's the same as the sawdust on Robert's wig. It came from the dummy in the Coffin act, but the Montarros haven't done the act yet. Ryan remembers seeing the same sawdust in the wine cellar, and they figure Micki is there.

Monte comes out on stage and introduces Montarro, Meanwhile, Ryan and Jack find the Box in the wine cellar. Montarro enters the Coffin and Lyla pulls the armature lever. Jack manages to open the Box and Micki gets out just in time. Montarro is killed by the sword blades in the Coffin, and they return to the stage as Lyla screams in horror. Assistants get Montarro's corpse out of the Coffin and take the hysterical Lyla away.

Later at the store, Jack ties Ryan in a straitjacket and chains. Micki joins them and Ryan jokingly suggests that she could turn psycho just like Lyla. She cheerfully tightens the straitjacket, and Ryan says that he can get out. He has Micki time his escape, and Micki and Jack go to get some coffee while Ryan tries to escape without success.

description: Micki, Ryan and Jack track down a cursed scalpel that has found its way into the hands of a talented surgeon.
tags: ['cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'human sacrifice', 'sacrifice', 'cursed object', 'surgeon', 'surgical mask', 'medical', 'doctor', 'latex gloves', 'antique store', 'curse', 'jack-the-ripper', 'friday the 13th']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A man walks down a city street and comes to a street vendor selling flowers. The vendor offers the man flowers, and the man offers the vendor a large bill. It blows down the street on the wind, and the vendor goes after it down a nearby alley. Meanwhile, the man removes an antique scalpel from a case, goes down the alley, and cuts the vendor's throat with the scalpel. Passing people at the mouth of the alley see the murder, and the killer runs down the alley to a gate. He cuts through the bars with the scalpel and makes his escape.

The next day at Curious Goods, Jack reads an entry in the manifest about a Victorian surgical scalpel that Lewis sold, from the late 19th century. Jack and the cousins have read the newspaper report about the eyewitnesses reporting that the killer sliced through the gate using a scalpel, but Micki isn't convinced. Lewis sold it to James Bronson, and there's nothing else in the manifest that fits the eyewitnesses' description. Jack goes to do some research on Bronson before they visit him, and Micki finds a note in the manifest that the scalpel may have belonged to Jack the Ripper, when he committed his murders in the summer of 1888.

Later, the cousins drive to rendezvous with Jack outside of Bronson's blade shop. He joins them and says that Bronson is an ex-con still on parole, and he was convicted of an assault with a deadly weapon. Bronson was known as a craftsman with a blade, and they go into the shop. When they ask about antique knives, Bronson immediately says that he doesn't carry them. Jack describes the scalpel, and Bronson jams a finger between Jack's fingers on the counter and tells him not waste his time. He says that he doesn't remember buying an antique scalpel.

Micki yells from across the room, and Bronson blurts out that she couldn't have found it because she sold it. He refuses to identity the buyer, until Jack threatens to give some negative over to Bronson's parole officer. Bronson caves and say that he sold the scalpel two years ago to Dr. Vincent Howlett. Jack is familiar with Howlett, and the trio leaves. Outside, Jack tells the cousins that Howlett is known as the "miracle man" and has turned surgical into big business... for him. Howlett calls all of the most hopeless cases and cures them. As for the negatives, they're from Micki and Ryan at the zoo and Jack was bluffing.

At Ravenbrook Hospital where he now works, Howlett is giving a lecture to visiting doctors while performing an operation. He finishes the operation and the doctors applaud, and Jean Flappen is also in the observation gallery watching Howlett intensely. Afterward, Vince goes out into the hallway with the head of surgery, Dr. Patricia Price. Price introduces Howlett to the waiting doctors and welcomes Howlett to the hospital, congratulating him on his "premiere" surgery. Howlett gives a speech, noting that he hopes his skills can help the hospital's "somewhat tarnished" reputation. Price glares at him as he leaves.

As the trio drives to Ravenbrook, Jack says that he's heard the hospital has been having some setbacks and need Howlett to restore their reputation for outmoded equipment and poor patient care. There have been some malpractice suits filed against them, and minor scandals among the staff. Jack says that Howlett loves the limelight, but his critics say that he's turning medicine into a circus. He notes that Jack the Ripper was supposed to be a doctor.

Price asks Howlett what he does on his time off, and Howlett plays coy saying it's boring. She says that she remembers him from medical school when she his professor, and is surprised he became a surgeon. Howlett tells her that his track record speaks for itself, and asks if she's jealous of his reputation. Price says that she doesn't approve of his "show biz" approach to surgery, and he tells her that it works and then leaves. The woman from the operating gallery, Jean Flappen, secretly watches Howlett and then goes.

The trio arrive and Jack asks for Howlett. Micki sees an ER patient being given resuscitation measures

Jean puts up a photo of a girl on a door ahead of Howlett and runs off. Howlett sees the photo and tosses it on the floor, and Flappen steps out behind him and aims a revolver at him. The trio come by and Ryan pulls the gun up. Howlett doesn't hear her, and Jean yells that Howlett is a killer and they should let her kill Howlett before he kills again. Micki runs after Howlett, and orderlies take the screaming Jean away. Ryan goes after Micki and Howlett, and Jack checks Jean's discarded purse and finds an article about the death of her daughter.

Howlett goes to his office and Micki stands outside in the hallway.

The orderlies strap Jean to a bed and leave. Jack slips in and asks her about her daughter. Jean says that Howlett carved her up when she was in med school, and she worshiped Howlett. She heard Howlett was coming to town, went to where he was staying and said she would talk to him. Later, the police called Jean and said they found her daughter's carved-up body. Jean didn't know Howlett killed her, but she had to do something and started following him. Everywhere he went there was another killing, but he was too smart to make a slip and she couldn't let him go on. Jack asks about the weapon, saying that he's a friend, but he can't release her. Jean figures that Jack is in on it and yells that she'll kill him as he leaves.

Howlett looks at the scalpel contemplatively, and Micki comes in and claims that she's a supply staffer. She says that she's there to make sure he got everything he needs, then quickly leaves. Ryan is in the hallway outside, and Micki tells him that she saw the scalpel. Ryan sends her to tell Jack, who is in the waiting room. She goes to Ryan and tells him what she's discovered, and Jack worries that Howlett will go after Ryan if he suspects Ryan knows something.

After Howlett leaves his office and walks down the hallway, Ryan emerges from hiding and goes after the doctor. Howlett enters a wing of the hospital under construction and Ryan goes in after him. Meanwhile, Micki and Jack go into Howlett's office. Jack finds the scalpel case but the scalpel is gone. According to Howlett's surgery schedule, he's not down to operate again that day so Micki wonders where he went with the scalpel. Jack figures that Howlett is also using the scalpel to kill, and it gives him the power to cure. Killing people "recharges" the scalpel, and Micki and Jack figure Ryan is Howlett's next intended victim.

Ryan peers through a grate into an adjoining room, and sees Howlett opening a locker where he stores the scalpel.

Jack and Micki find a nurse, who says that she saw Howlett but doesn't know where he is. They see the door to the closet wing but figure Howlett didn't go there.

Howlett takes the coat and hat he wears when committing the murders out of the locker, as Ryan watches. Ryan slips on the box he's standing on, making a ruckus. He runs, and Howlett gets the scalpel and goes after him. Micki and Jack hear the noise and go into the closed wing. Meanwhile, Ryan goes into the old morgue and hides in one of the drawers. Howlett comes in and sees a drawer partially open. He yanks open the drawer and stabs the cloth-shrouded body inside.

Micki and Jack come in and Micki yells Ryan's name. Howlett runs out, while Micki confirms that the body wasn't Ryan's. Ryan yells to her from the drawer he's in, and Micki gets him out. Meanwhile, Jack chases Howlett to a freight elevator and tackles him. They struggle and Howlett shoves Jack into an open elevator. Jack grabs the cable, and Howlett slices through it with the scalpel. Jack falls down the shaft, and Howlett runs when he hears Micki and Ryan coming. They see Jack lying at the bottom of the shaft.

The doctors are summoned, and take Jack to an operating room. Price talks to the waiting Micki and Ryan, and asks if Jack has any family. They say that he's their family, and Price says that they may need one of them to sign the release for surgery. Once Price leaves, Ryan goes as well, telling Micki that he has to do something.

Price goes to Howlett's office and finds him standing in the darkness, contemplating the scalpel. She tells him that they need him to operate. Price says that the patient is no one important, and has no chance of living unless Howlett performs one of his "miracles". Howlett says that he can't operate that night, and Price tells him that he's there to improve the hospital's reputation and the press has gotten hold of Jack's case. They're there expecting to see the "miracle man" in action. Howlett agrees to perform the surgery at 8:30 when it's scheduled, and Price leaves.

Later, Howlett goes out looking for a victim.

Ryan goes to Jean's room. Meanwhile, Jean complains to the orderly on guard that her straps are too tight, and asks him to loosen them a tad. When he loans over to do so, Jean knocks him unconscious with a flower vase, takes his keys, and leaves.

Price visits Micki and says that Jack has an aortal aneurysm. She warns that it's almost already fatal, and the best surgeon in the country has agreed to do the surgery with Micki's consent. Micki realizes that Price is talking about Howlett.

Howlett approaches a skateboarder on his own. He pulls out the scalpel, but before he can attack the boy's friends arrive. They skate off and Howlett walks off, looking for another victim.

Ryan steals a set of doctor's scrubs.

When the nurse on duty is distracted, Jean breaks into the locker holding the patients' belongings. She gets her gun and clothing, and leaves.

Howlett approaches a prostitute and takes out the scalpel. His pager goes off and she runs into a nearby building. Angry, Howlett turns off his pager and walks off.

Jean dresses in the ladies room, then go out

Howlett returns to the hospital and scrubs up. Price berates him for running late, and when he sets the scalpel down on the sink, Ryan steals it and leaves. Howlett notices the theft, while Ryan goes back to Micki and tells him that he has the scalpel. She tells Ryan that he has to give the scalpel back so that Howlett can save Jack.

Howlett searches desperately for the scalpel. Price tells him to get hold of himself. Ryan comes in and gives Howlett the scalpel. Howlett and Price go into the operating room, and Price points out his "admiring public" in the gallery. When he holds the scalpel, Howlett hesitates and Price asks if anything is wrong. He tells her not to worry about him and says that he's not going to lose Jack or any patient ever again. Jack's face is covered, so Howlett doesn't realize he's operating on the man who attacked him earlier. Jean watches from the gallery.

Micki and Ryan wait in the waiting room, and Ryan talks about how he and his parents never got along. He says that Jack is the only one who ever acted like he had something on the ball.

The anesthetist removes the cloth on Jack's face, and Howlett realizes who he's operating on. When he hesitates, Price and the other operating staff look at him, puzzled. Howlett realizes that he can't let Jack die without risking his reputation, and goes back to operating.

Mick tells Jack that they can't let Howlett get away no matter what happens to Jack, because it isn't what Jack would want.

Howlett continues operating on Jack, and finally says that he's done. He tells the nurse that he'll supervise Jack's post-op personally.

Price tells Micki and Ryan that Jack survived the surgery. Ryan asks where Howlett is, claiming they want to thank him, and Price says that he's in scrubs and wanted to supervise the post-op personally.

Howlett goes to Jack's room and prepares to kill him, cutting through his respirator tube with the scalpel. Jean comes in, aiming her gun at Howlett, and tells him to face her. He does so, invites her to come closer, then slices through the gun with the scalpel. He cuts her hands, and Ryan and Micki hear her scream and run in.

When Howlett runs out, Ryan and Mick go after him. They chase him into the abandoned wing, and Howlett jumps on Ryan's back. He cuts through the garbage lid Micki is using as a shield, and the cousins run. Howlett goes after them, and they lock themselves in a boiler room. The doctor cuts a hole the metal door with the scalpel and comes in, and Jean comes up behind him and knocks him over the head.

The cousins run out and come to another dead end. Ryan grabs a crutch as a weapon, and tells Micki to hide behind a crash cart. Howlett arrives and finds both cousins gone. Ryan drops down from the steam pipes onto the doctor, and Mick shoves a storage bin onto Gorman's hand and head when he comes at Ryan with the scalpel. Micki charges up the paddles on the crash cart and when Gorman comes at her after punching Ryan unconscious, she uses them on the scalpel. Gorman is electrocuted and falls over. Ryan wakes up and turns Gorman comes over, and discovers that he fell on the scalpel and it plunged into his chest.

Later at the store, Micki tends to the recovering Jack. She assures him that they put the scalpel in the vault, and Ryan returns from the airport and that Jean is heading back home. Jack says that it's time to go back to work, despite the doctors' advice that he take it easy. The cousins side with the doctors and tell Jack to relax, and Ryan points out that with Howlett out of the way, he won't be sending Jack a bill.

description: Micki and Ryan investigate the murder of a gym owner and realize that a mysterious pair of boxing gloves may be to blame.
tags: ['shadow', 'shadowy figure', 'shadow boxing', 'evil shadow', 'shadow monster', 'boxing', 'cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'sacrifice', 'human sacrifice', 'boxing ring', 'boxing match', 'boxing knockout', 'killer shadow', 'boxing gloves', 'boxing referee', 'cursed boxing gloves', 'boxing trainer', 'killed by a shadow', 'pair of boxing gloves', 'boxing gym', 'supernatural revenge', 'cursed object']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At Manny's Gym, boxer Kid Cornelius is working out a bag under the coaching of the owner, Manny King. The janitor, Tommy Dunn, looks on, and one boxer sarcastically calls him "tough guy". Tommy goes into Manny's office and takes a pair of antique boxing gloves out of a box, and looks at them. Manny comes in and asks Tommy what he's doing, Tommy asks if he can borrow the gloves, saying that they belonged to Killer Kelsey. Manny asks if he's going to use them to beat up somebody who owes money, and Tommy insists that he did his time as an enforced and doesn't do it anymore. When Manny yanks the gloves back, Tommy says that Manny is just like the rest of them and won't give him a break. Manny tells Tommy that he's no boxer, and tells him to get out of his office and sweep the floor.

Later, Cornelius is heading out and sees Tommy working out with a rope. Tommy tells Cornelius that he's still hoping to get a shot at him, and Cornelius says that he wouldn't waste his time and Tommy is a lost cause. Tommy watches Cornelius talk to Manny before he goes, and later steals the gloves. He goes to the locker room and puts them on, and Manny yells to him from the door that he's going home. Manny tells Tommy to keep his nose clean and leaves, and Tommy throws air-punches with the gloves. His hands shake and he is pulled toward the wall. When the gloves touch the gloves that his shadow is "wearing", the shadow separates from the wall and walks out.

Manny walks down an alleyway on his way home, and the shadow comes up behind him. Tommy can sense what the shadow senses and whispers Manny's name. Manny hears the voice and sees the shadow, and recognizes it as Tommy's. The shadow cuts off Manny as he tries to walk out of the alley, then corners Manny in a dead-end.

In the gym, Tommy works out a bag. He punches it off its hinges, and in the alleyway the shadow beats Manny to death.

In the alleyway, the dying Manny writes "To" in his own blood on a nearby piece of cardboard.

The next day at the store, Micki takes a photo of Ryan with a flash bulb attachment. She says that she's making a photo diary for Lloyd. Jack gets a call from Manny's widow asking them to look at her dead husband's boxing memorabilia. She called them because Manny bought some stuff from Lewis, like the gloves. The gloves are listed in the manifest, and the original owner Kelsey killed an opponent in his ring. Jack was at the fight, and Kelsey hung up the gloves, "went strange", and never threw another punch.

The trio go to Manny's Gym and Micki takes photo. Ryan and Jack go through Manny's things and discover that the gloves aren't there. Manny's widow Sadie comes in and talks about how Manny wanted to start a boxing museum. Micki joins them and asks how Manny died, and Sadie says that he was beaten to death in a nearby alley. There were only one set of footprints at the scene of the crime, and they found the letters "To" written nearby.

Micki continues taking photos, including of boxer Tony Terrific. Tommy comes over and shoves Tony aside, and invites Micki to take photos of him. She isn't impressed, and Cornelius comes over and tells Tommy to get lost. Tommy tells him to mind his own business and Tommy invites him to say it to him in the ring. Unimpressed, Cornelius says that he won't waste his time with Tommy. After Tommy leaves, Micki thanks Cornelius and they introduce themselves. She checks his gloves, just like she checked Tony's, looking for the "Killer" stamped on them like were stamped on the cursed gloves. Cornelius says that Tommy has had more losses as a boxer than anyone in the city. Micki thanks Cornelius for his help and takes a photo of him as he walks away.

That night at his fight, outside, Tommy invites Tony to come in and see him fight. Tony dismisses Tommy, and Tony says that Tommy will never know what hit him. Tommy shrugs off his gibe and goes inside, laughing. Jack is nearby and overhears the exchange.

In the locker room, Tommy goes by himself and releases the shadow. Tommy then goes out in the ring and fights with his opponent. Outside, the shadow confronts Tony and beats him to death. Inside, Tommy beats his opponent with the power of the gloves, shrugging off his opponent's blows. Ryan, Micki, and Jack are there and look on as Tommy wins. Micki snaps a photo of Tommy's gloves and sees the "Killer" stamped on them. She tells Ryan and Jack that Tommy is wearing the gloves, and Jack figures that Manny was trying to leave Tommy's name in his blood.

A man runs in and yells that Tony is dead, beaten to death and left on the hood of a car. Tommy has left the ring, and Ryan goes to check Tommy's locker for the gloves. Ryan breaks into the locket and finds a medical report on Tommy. Cornelius comes over and asks Ryan if he's looking for something. Ryan claims that he gave his wallet to Tommy to hold, but Cornelius doesn't believe him and finds Ryan's wallet in his back pocket. The boxer gives Ryan the wallet and tells him to get out.

The trio go to the apartment building where Tommy lives. Micki gets an idea and goes to a nearby pay phone. She calls Tommy and suggests they go for coffee. Tommy agrees and leaves, and Ryan and Jack break into Tommy's apartment while Micki goes to the nearby diner where she agreed to meet Tommy. She picks at her food to stall, and Tommy invites her back to his place for a "nightcap". Micki turns on the charm, and Tommy says that he can't lose at anything. She tries to beg off, saying she has to work, but Tommy figures she's playing him as a sucker and grabs her arm. Tommy tosses down money for the tab and goes back to his apartment.

Micki goes to the phone booth and calls Tommy's apartment. Ryan and Jack don't pick the phone up, but they hear Tommy come in and hide. Tommy realizes someone has been searching his place and spots them, and figures that Micki was trying to distract him. He grabs the gloves from a hidden hole in the wall, knocks Ryan down, and shoves Jack out of the apartment.

In the alleyway near Micki, the shadow appears.

Tommy advances on Ryan and throws a punch at him, and Ryan ducks. Meanwhile, Micki uses her flash attachment on the shadow. It's blinded, and so is Tommy. The attachment recharges, and Ryan tries to grab the gloves from Tommy. He fails and runs out, and on the street below the shadow fades away. Micki joins Jack and Ryan as they come out, and she says that she has to get the film from her camera developed.

Back at the store, Micki tells Jack what she saw. Ryan gets the photos developed and when the trio go over them, the shadow isn't there. Jack finds a shot of it and Micki figures that it was when the flash didn't work. The older man suggests that when Tommy wears the gloves, his shadow goes after his victims. His dark side is unleashed by the gloves, and they figure that someone else will be murdered the next time Tommy goes into the ring.

Tommy goes to the gym and everyone congratulates him. He challenged Cornelius to a fight, but Cornelius refuses. Meanwhile, the trio arrive and Jack figures Tommy won't let the gloves out of his sight. Cornelius hears them talking about how Tommy killed Manny and Tony, and he confronts Tommy and punches him in the face. He tells Tommy that he'll fight them that night, and Tommy promises that he'll be there with his gloves on. The trio overhear his confrontation and confront him, and Micki tells Cornelius that he can't fight Tommy but can't explain why. Cornelius says that he agrees with them that Tommy killed Manny, and Manny was like a father to him. Once Cornelius leaves, Jack figures they have to make sure no one gets killed.

That night, everyone gathers for the fight. The trio are in the audience, and Jack tells Ryan to wait for his opportunity. He then goes into the locker room and tells Tommy that he knows about the gloves. Jack claims that he saw Tommy steal the gloves, and threatens to go to the cops. He says that Tommy gets to keep the gloves while Jack gets 70% of Tommy's winnings. Smirking, Tommy agrees and tells him to wait for him out in the parking lot.

Jack goes out to the parking lot where Micki is waiting, and says that they have to use Tommy's rage against him. Inside, Tommy unleashes the shadow then goes to the ring. Jack comes in and taunts Tommy, and Tommy and Cornelius fight.

Jack goes outside and the shadow comes after him.

Tommy rallies and starts beating Cornelius.

Micki uses a bright flashlight on the shadow. Inside, Tommy is blinded and Cornelius beats him. Outside, the shadow disappears in the bright light and inside, Cornelius beats Tommy. The shadow comes after Micki and Jack, and the flashlight battery fades. It knocks the light out of her hand, and Jack taunts the shadow over to him. Micki pulls the car over and blinds the shadow with the headlights, and Cornelius finishes off Tommy. Ryan jumps into the ring and grabs the gloves from Tommy, while everyone cheers Cornelius.

Back at the store, Ryan puts the gloves in the vault. Micki says that what they did wasn't enough, and Tommy will get away with killing two people. Ryan points out that Tommy has a perfect alibi, and Micki goes to her bedroom and tries to sleep. Ryan comes to her door and asks if she's all right. She says that she is and turns down his offer of cocoa.

Tommy breaks into Micki's room and puts a knife to her face. He demands his gloves, then takes her with them to go get them. Ryan hears them and calls to Micki, going out. Micki breaks free of Tommy, and Tommy threatens Ryan with his knife. He grabs Micki and tells Ryan to get the gloves or he'll cut her. Jack comes in and begs Tommy not to hurt Micki. Ryan goes to get the gloves, and Jack tries to move in on Tommy but Tommy spots him and invites him to try it.

When Tommy prepares to stab Micki anyway, she yells that he's hurting him, breaking his concentration. Jack points out that Tommy has no alibi, but nobody can prove anything up to now and he's outsmarted everyone. If Tommy kills them, the authorities will know. Tommy figures that he's a nobody without the gloves, and figures the trio stepped on him just like everyone else.

Ryan returns with one of the gloves, his other hand behind his back. Tommy realizes that there's only one glove and demands the other one, and Ryan hits Jack with his other glove-clad hand. Ryan's shadow appears and beats Tommy, while Ryan beats Jack. Micki tries to pull the glove off of Ryan's hand, and he gives it up. His cousin goes to Jack, and Ryan insists that he had to put on the glove to save Micki. Jack recovers and tells Ryan that it was the stupidest thing he's ever done, and Micki goes to call an ambulance for Tommy. Meanwhile, Jack looks at the unconscious Tommy and says that sometimes a person brings justice on themselves.

The next day, Cornelius brings Tommy things to the shelf. The commission confirmed that Cornelius' fight had nothing to do with Tommy being hurt, and Tommy had scar tissue on the brain from all the head shots he took in the past. Cornelius says that it felt like he would be doing something for Manny when he beat Tommy, but Manny would have had nothing to do with it. Micki says that Tommy just came over and started shouting, then collapsed. Cornelius says that he's going to run Manny's Gym for Sadie and leaves. Jack tells Ryan that he holds Ryan responsible for what happened to him, and half-jokingly promises revenge.

description: Ryan and Micki search for a cursed mulcher which is the murder weapon of choice for a gardener's assistant.
tags: ['cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'sacrifice', 'human sacrifice', 'cursed object']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Months Earlier

At a suburban home, Mrs. O'Connor is trimming her hedges. She tells her son, Harley, to start the mulcher and come over to help her. Harley starts the mulcher up, and then kills his mother with his rake. He feeds her into the mulcher, smiling.

Now

At Curious Goods, Jack finds a letter to Lewis that he never opened, postmarked the day after Lewis died. Jack has opened it and found a $100 in it. There's also a note from the sender, thanking Lewis and saying that he's realized they both enjoy using the cutting edge of their knowledge from below. The $100 is a thank-you gift to Lewis, and the letter is sent. The postmark identifies the letter from Temple Heights. Ryan checks the manifest and finds one buyer in Temple Heights: Harley. The item sold was a 50-year old portable mulcher.

Ryan picks up the phone to call Harley, and overhears Micki on the phone talking to her fiancé, Lloyd. Ryan quietly hangs up, while Micki tells Lloyd that she knows it' been two months and he just has to trust her because she has unfinished business. Micki assures Lloyd that she still wants to marry him, figures it will take another month to finish her "business", and insists that she's not having an affair. Lloyd hangs up, and Micki breaks into tears.

Adrian is working on a rich person's yard when they drive by, splashing mud and water in Adrian's face. The woman's landscaper, Charles, goes over and helps his client, Amanda, out of the car. Amanda says that the meeting went well and the planning commission has said they can open their doors to the public the next day. She figures that her father William would have been proud, because he always wanted to give something to the city and now she's donating the lands to the city as a park. They go inside for lunch as Adrian glares at Amanda.

Smitty comes over and tells Adrian that he's doing a good job. Adrian says that he could use more money, and Smitty leads Adrian to where there's work that needs doing.

Jack and Micki go to Harley's house, but the place is long abandoned. Micki figures that there's no point investigating further and they have one less curse to recover. She tells Jack that she's sick of the "job" of recovering antiques, that they've been stuck with. Micki says that she never wanted the life, and Jack points out that he and Ryan are trapped as well, and they have a responsibility. Relenting, Micki goes into the house with Jack.

Smitty is throwing branches into the mulcher when Adrian comes over and says that he's finished. Adrian looks at the mulcher's swirling blades, fascinated, and Smitty asks if he's okay. After a moment, Adrian tears himself away from the machine and goes back to work.

Jack and Micki go into the house, while a man secretly watches them go in. Micki knocks over a board and screams in shock, and Jack finds a $5 bill nearby. Meanwhile, the man comes in wielding a crowbar. He asks Jack and Micki what they're doing there, and Jack explains that they're looking for Harley and sold an antique to him that they'd like to get back.

The neighbor has them step outside slowly and checks their business card. The man says that he looks after the place, and Harley was an accountant talking about financial futures. Several months ago Harley was locked up, after he was found with a bag of money and it was confirmed his mother was missing. Some folks say that Harley murdered his mother, and he started screaming about "the mouth of hell" when the police questioned him about his mother's disappearance. Harley attacked the police and was locked up.

On the Pierson grounds, Adrian looks at the mulcher. He tells Smitty that he'll finish up on his own so Smitty can go home early, and insists that he wants to make a good impression. A group of vagrants are sitting nearby, the leader drinking and watching the two gardeners. Smitty drives off, and Adrian goes to the mulcher. It starts up on its own and Adrian stares into the swirling blades. The vagrant leader calls to Adrian by name and comes over. He says that there's a lot of interest on Adrian on the streets, because he owes too much to the wrong people.

Adrian insists that he's good for it, and the vagrant tells him to tell the legbreakers that will come for him. He figures Adrian wants to pay him to stay quiet, and asks for $500 a week for his quiet. Adrian says that he'll kill the vagrant if he opens his mouth, and the mulcher starts up on its own. The vagrant tells Adrian that he's a pretty boy and is all talk. Adrian knocks the vagrant unconscious with the man's own bottle, then shoves him into the mulcher. Dollar bills shoot out of the other end, and Adrian gleefully pockets them, laughing.

That night at the store, Jack tells the cousins that the mulcher was sold at a police auction three months ago. A Robert Smith bought it, and Jack is trying to track him down. Ryan is worried about Micki, and says that Lloyd is a dork. Jack examines the bill he found and says that it's brand new but dated 1937. The $100 bill Harley sent to Lewis is also dated 1937 and brand new, and suggests that Harley might talk to Lewis. As for Micki, Jack tells Ryan that she'll have to work out her issues all by herself.

Micki is making herself up for bed as a man lurks outside her window. She sees the man's shadow on the drapes, goes to Ryan's room, and tell him that there's an intruder outside her window.
