The man breaks in through the window, and Ryan shoves him to the floor and starts choking him. Micki stops Ryan, realizing that the intruder is Lloyd. She hugs him, and Ryan introduces himself and points out that most people use the front door.

Micki has Ryan leave, and Lloyd explains that he flew out to take some dispositions. He says that he felt he didn't have a choice but to spy on Micki, to find out if there was another man in her life. Ryan listens at the door as Micki points out that Ryan is her cousin and nothing could be stranger than being involved with her. Lloyd wonders why Micki hasn't sold the shop yet, and Micki says that the store has been turning her life inside out. Her fiancé offers his legal expertise, and Micki says that it's about misplaced inventory. She says that she'll be home soon, but Lloyd tells her that he can't marry someone who isn't 100% honest with him. With that, Lloyd leaves the way he came.

The next day, Ryan visits Amanda at her home. She says that her husband deserves the credit for the beautiful grounds, and Ryan explains that he's with an antique store and wanted to buy the mulcher from Robert Smith: Smitty. Amanda directs Ryan to Smitty, and Ryan and Micki approaches the gardener. Micki is distracted by Lloyd, and doesn't believe it when Ryan says that things worked out for best between Micki and Lloyd.

The cousins talk to Smitty, who says that he has a vintage 1937 mulcher. He tells them that the mulcher isn't for sale, but agrees when Ryan offers him $2,500. Once Smitty goes to get it, Micki complains that they don't have $2,500. Meanwhile, Smitty goes to the mulcher, and Adrian calls him into the tool shed he's in to get Smitty's help. Smitty goes in, and Adrian kills him with a shovel. He then goes to get the mulcher, but when he returns he discovers that Smitty is gone.

Adrian grabs a trowel and searches for Smitty, who jumps at him. The younger man stabs Smitty to death with the trowel, then feeds Smitty's body into the mulcher and collects the bills that shoot out of the output pipe.

Jack goes to the mental hospital where Harley is locked up, and claims Lewis asked him to stop by and say hello. He shows Harley the two bills, but Harley tells Jack that he doesn't know him and orders him out. Jack tells him that Lewis is dead, getting Harley's attention, and says that he and Lewis were partners. Lewis tried to go back on his pact with Satan and was killed for it. Jack says that he wants to use the mulcher like Harley did, and he can use it out of the hospital and will share the money with Harley. Harley rambles about investing and says that if he agrees, Jack must choose more "expensive" victims. He laughs manically and twirls around in his wheelchair.

That night, Ryan and Micki return to the store and tell Jack that they found Smitty but he disappeared when he went to get the mulcher. Jack hushes them as Lloyd stands up and demands to know what's going on. Micki takes Lloyd to the basement to show him the cursed antiques.

Ryan talks to Jack, who says that the wealthier the victim, the more money the mulcher produces from them. When Jack wonders why the money is minted 1937, Ryan tells him that was when the mulcher was built. Jack wonders if Lloyd will believe Micki, but Ryan figures he won't.

Micki takes Lloyd into the vault and asks him to trust her. She insists that it's no fantasy, and tells Lloyd to put the doll down when he picks it up. It moves when Lloyd isn't looking, but Micki sees it and tells him that he has to get out. Lloyd agrees and they go upstairs to the front door. Once Lloyd leaves, Micki goes to her room. When Ryan starts to go after her, Jack tells him to give Micki some time.

The next day, Ryan and Jack go to the garden posing as volunteer gardeners. Jack checks around and confirms that Smitty never left the grounds, and suggests that Smitty is a victim. Adrian secretly watches them and listens in as they talk about Smitty.

Micki is lying on her bed, and Lloyd sneaks into the shop and comes up to her room. He says that he doesn't want to lose her.

Charles asks Adrian if he's seen Smitty, and Adrian says that Smitty is over by the shed. Charles insists on going on his own, and Adrian runs ahead of him.

Micki and Lloyd share a bottle of wine. Lloyd says that he believes Micki believes in the curse, and tells Micki that imagination is a powerful thing.

Adrian takes the mulcher out of its hiding spot in the trees and starts it up. He then goes into the shed and gets a hand scythe, as Charles arrives outside.

Lloyd asks Micki to come home with him the next day, and then they'll get things back the way they were. He figures that if Micki stays there, she wants to call off the wedding. Micki stares at Lloyd, contemplating.

Charles goes into the shed, calling for Smitty. Adrian kills him with the hand scythe then feeds him into the mulcher. Charles isn't dead, and screams as he's fed into the blades. Laughing, Adrian watches Charles die.

Micki and Lloyd kiss, and Micki tells him that she's coming home.

Amanda leads a group around the memorial for her late husband. She sees Adrian working and asks his name, and says that he's doing a fine job. As she move son with the group, Adrian takes out a bill from Charles and sniffs it, then puts it into his bag with the other bills as he looks at Amanda contemplatively.

That night, Ryan goes to the kitchen to wash up. Micki comes in humming with Lloyd, and Lloyd says that he'll pick her up the next day at noon and the plane leaves at 2. Once Lloyd goes, Ryan says that he's been pulling weeds trying to find a murderer, and Micki was in bed with Lloyd. He points out that the two of them sold some of the cursed antiques that are in the world, and Mick insists they did it in ignorance. Ryan says that they still have a responsibility, and Micki says that Ryan is only living there because he likes it. She wonders why she has to sacrifice her life for the antiques and the store, and Ryan points out that she has nothing to sacrifice except for the "snot-nosed" Lloyd. Micki slaps Ryan, who tells her that they need her to make the whole thing work out. He says that he needs her, and Micki says that she's sorry and walks out.

The next day, Ryan and Jack return to the garden. Jack checks with gardeners and confirms that there's no sign of Smitty. He realizes that Ryan is depressed and says that he'll miss Micki as well, but there's nothing they can do about it if her heart isn't in it. Ryan agrees and says that he has to do something, and they split up to search the house and grounds.

Ryan finds Adrian's bag with the bills inside, each with a 1937 date. Adrian sees Ryan and goes into the shed, and Ryan runs off to find Jack. On the way he sees Charles' discarded glasses and pockets them. He finds the mulcher hidden nearby in the trees, and Adrian finds him and stabs at him with an awl. Ryan narrowly avoids the blow and runs off, and Adrian chases him.

While passing the memorial, Ryan trips and knocks himself out when he hits his head. Adrian drags him to the gardening shed and locks the unconscious Ryan inside.

While waiting for Ryan to show up, Jack sees Micki arrive in a taxi with Lloyd. She goes over to Jack and says that she had to say goodbye before going. Jack hugs her and wishes her a safe journey, and Micki wonders where Ryan is.

Adrian recovers his awl and runs off.

When Jack tells Micki that Ryan disappeared, she insists on going to look for cousin. Lloyd figures that Jack set the whole thing up to keep Micki from leaving, and Micki points out that Jack didn't know she was coming.

Adrian drives a garden truck, towing the mulcher, to the manor. As Adrian goes up to the manor, Jack spots him and asks if he's seen Ryan. Adrian abruptly says that he hasn't and continues on his way. Jack goes the way Adrian came from, and sees the mulcher hooked up to the cart. Ryan is calling for help from the shed, and Jack hears him, runs over, and releases him. Ryan describes Adrian, and Jack realizes that he just talked to the killer, who is going after Amanda as the richest person there.

Adrian breaks into Amanda's office, and she recognizes him from earlier. He says that she can set him up for life, and Amanda screams. Micki hears the screams and runs in, while Adrian tells Amanda to shut up. She comes in with Lloyd and they see Adrian threatening Amanda, and Adrian grabs Amanda as a shield and yells at them to get back.

Adrian takes Amanda to the mulcher, and Micki and Lloyd follow them. Ryan and Jack see Adrian coming and hide behind the cart. Ryan grabs the bag of money, tells Jack to distract Adrian, and runs off. Jack yells at Adrian that they know about the mulcher and it's over, but Adrian figures that he's still a rich man. Ryan starts up the mulcher and dumps the money from the bag in. Adrian releases Amanda, jumps into the mulcher chute to grab the money and is pulled in by the blades. Micki checks on Ryan, who hugs her in relief. Nothing but blood comes out of the output chute, and Jack figures Adrian wasn't even worth a dollar.

Later at the shop, Lloyd tells Micki that they saw a tragedy. Jack and Ryan have Micki involved in something dangerous. She says that it's what she does, and she has a responsibility to get back all the things they sold. Lloyd dismisses Ryan as a commercial school dropout, while Ryan listens in while cleaning. Micki tells Lloyd that if he cared about her, he'd try to understand. She insists that at least Ryan is honest and cares, and turns away from Lloyd. Lloyd leaves, and Micki tells Ryan to leave her alone and goes up to her room.

Ryan follows Micki to her door and asks if there's anything he can do. She yells at him to leave her alone, and he goes to his room. He puts up a banner welcoming Micki home, as Micki comes in and apologizes for yelling at him. She sees the banner, smiles, and thanks Ryan.

description: Ryan believes that a half-man, half-monster comic-book hero has come to life and is responsible for the murder of a shopkeeper.
tags: ['cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'sacrifice', 'human sacrifice', 'cursed object', 'cursed book']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A punk and comic book fan, Cal, is looking around a comic book store. He sees a rare copy of "Tales of the Undead" Issue One on display by the owner, Charlie Evans. The cover displays the comics hero, Ferrus. Cal goes over to Charlie to buy his comic books, and they discuss Ooo's fascination with Ferrus. Charlie says that the creator, Jay Star, signed the issue. The owner says that the issue has been appraised as priceless, and Cal says that he'd kill for a comic like that. Charlie figures that he'll get at least $25,000 for it and invites Cal to sign up for the shop's free-comics-for-a-year contest. Cal says that 'Tales of the Undead' is the only comic he wants, and Charlie tells him that Cal has no chance of getting 'Tales'.

Cal signs up the contest and puts his name on a slip that he puts into the entry box. Ryan comes in and Charlie greets him by name, and Ryan says that Jack flew to Singapore so he has to run Curious Goods by himself. Charlie shows him the 'Tales' issue, that Cal is staring at. Ferrus is Ryan's favorite, and Charlie says that he got it at an estate sale. Charlie shows off Jay's signature, and says that he's selling it at auction at that Briggs is holding in two days.

As Charlie and Ryan go back to the counter, Cal breaks into the case holding issue one, while Ryan goes into the back room. Charlie sees Call and goes over to confront him, and Cal screams that he has to have it, shoves Cal away, breaks the glass of the case with his arm, and grabs the comic. Charlie goes to call the cops, and the room shakes as Cal transforms into the robot-like Ferrus. Ferrus chokes Charlie to death, throws away the body, and goes on a rampage. Ryan sees what's going on, runs in, and Ferrus knocks him aside before walking out the back.

The next day at the store, Ryan examines a piece of metal that came off of Ferrus's suit, while Micki looks on. She's skeptical of his claim that a comic book character beat him up, but Ryan insists that it was Ferrus, not a guy in a suit. Ryan says that in the first issue of the comic, a kid got the Ferrus powers the same way from a magic book. Micki checks the manifest under "Magazines", and discovers that Lewis bought it from Jacob Starenski. Ryan realizes that it's the real name of "Jay Star", the creator of Ferrus, which built Peerless Comics single-handedly. Jay wrote Ferrus for a few years and then disappeared, and supposedly died in poverty, a broken man. The date is recent and the seller's address is listed, Ryan has Micki go the store and check with the cops, while he investigates the seller.

Ryan drives to Jay's home, off in the country. The house maid, Mrs. Forbes, tells Ryan that Jay doesn't take visitors, particularly who she assumes is a reporter looking for a story on the 40th anniversary of Ferrus's premiere. When Ryan yells through the door that he's a fan, Jay hears him and tells Forbes to let Ryan in.

The embittered old Jay tells Ryan not to mind Forbes, saying that she's been taking care of him for years. He dismisses himself as a worn-out old man and a has-been, and says that his name is hardly reverted. Ryan talks about how he started because of Jay, and asks for Jay's autograph. Once Jay gives it, he asks Ryan why he's there. Ryan sees a comic book artist award nearby, from 1947, and Jay says that it was for the appearance of Ferrus. As Jay talks about Ferrus was going to be his passport to fame and money, Ryan asks him if he knows anyone so obsessed with Ferrus that he would kill over the comic book.

Jay says that he doesn't know anyone except for an editor or two in the old days. Forbes, listening in, says that Peerless cheated Jay out of his money. Jay abruptly dismisses her, and then tells Ryan that they stole and connived their way to the top on his work. Peerless got everything except a few old issues that Jay kept and later sold, and some original art: censored scenes that Jay keeps in the basement as insurance against a "cold day".

When Jay says that he's seen cruel miracles and nothing could surprise him, Ryan tells him that Ferrus has come to life. He explains that an original issue became cursed and lets the holder transform into Ferrus, and Charlies was killed. Jay knows Charlie and says that he has one of the best collections in the city. Jay laughs at the idea that it sounds crazy.

Ryan leaves, and Jay tells Forbes to get him his coat. He goes to the store where Charlie's daughter Linda is packing things up, and offers his condolences on Charlie's death. Jay goes through the entry box and finds the slip with Cal's name on it, with 'Tales of the Undead' as the issue he wants to receive a year of . It also has Cal's address on it, and Jay takes the slip with him.

At this apartment, Cal is calling Carmine DeMaddio to sell Ferrus himself. As Carmine hangs up, Jay comes in via the open door and says that he and Carmine go way back. Jay presents proof of who he is and Cal is awe-struck. The artist demands the comic, saying that it was his to begin with and it was stolen from him. Cal picks up the comic and begs Jay not to make him do something he doesn't want to do. Jay says that he won't end up like Charlie and threatens to tell the authorities. Cal transforms into Ferrus and advances on Jay, who takes an award from beneath his jacket and stabs Ferrus in the chest. Ferrus collapses to the floor and transforms into the dead Cal, and Jay takes the comic and leaves.

At the store, Ryan tells Micki that he was humiliated by Jay laughing at him. He thought Jay would at least believe in the possibility of the supernatural. Micki doesn't get the appeal of Ferrus, and Ryan talks about how comics inspired little kids like himself. His cousin sympathizes and goes back to reading the comic, and lists of Ferrus' powers. Ryan is reading the newspaper and sees an article about Cal's death.

The cousins go to Cal's apartment and search through the debris. Micki finds Carmine's name written on a pad, and Ryan recognizes him as the publisher of 'Tales of the Undead'. Ryan and Micki go to Carmine's office, and he freely admits that Cal called him. He says that Jay sold his rights to Ferrus in 1948 but then lost the money in a land swindle. Jay tried to kill Ferrus off, coming up with some way to kill "Ferrus the Invincible". Peerless never published the issue, and Carmine doesn't remember where the pages are. Carmine says that they'll never publish the "death of" issue, but suggests that the issue might show up at the auction.

Later, Jay comes to Carmine's office Jay says that he's there to stake a claim on Ferrus, and sees a panel of Jay's artwork. Carmine says that he bought it, and Jay angrily tells the publisher that it's his and he never sold it. He accuses Carmine of stealing it like everything in his life, and promises that he's going to get back. Jay uses the comic to transform into Ferrus, and Carmine runs and sets off the fire alarm. Carmine then gets into the freight elevator, and before it can go down Ferrus smashes in through the door and chokes Carmine to death.

Ryan and Micki hear the fire alarm and see that the elevator is still on the floor with Carmine's office. The elevator comes down with Ferrus in it along with Carmine's broken body. The cousins hide before Ferrus sees them, and Ferrus walks past them. The police arrive outside, and the cousins follow Ferrus out. The police open fire, but the bullet impacts knock Ferrus down. Once the police go back to their cars to call it in, Ferrus gets up, unharmed, and walks off.

Back at the store, Micki says that they have to find the comics. Ryan wonders how they will stop Ferrus if he's bulletproof, and figures the comic that "kills" Ferrus holds the secret of Ferrus' vulnerability. He suggests they go to Jay to get the issue.

The cousins drive to Jay's house and Forbes answers the door. Jay hears Ryan and tells Forbes to have Ryan go away. When Ryan yells that he saw Ferris, Jay changes his mind and dismisses Forbes. Once Forbes leaves, Jay insists that there is no Ferrus. Ryan says that he saw Ferrus and he was shot down and walked away. Jay confirms that Ryan didn't tell the police anything, and Ryan asks him for the issue where Jay killed off Ferrus or any notes he might have. The artist claims that he would have sold the issue ago, and doesn't remember anything. Jay tells Ryan to go, and Ryan leaves.

Out in the car, Micki suggests that they check Briggs Art Gallery to see if the issue has turned up there.

Jay goes through the old issues he kept, and discovers that the "death of" issue is gone. Forbes confronts him and says that he couldn't have left well enough alone. She admits that she sold the issue to raise the money, and she didn't stick around because she loved Jay. Forbes goes to pack, and Jay says that she doesn't have to go if she doesn't want to. First, Jay asks who she sold the issue to. Forbes says that she sold it to a dealer, Ted Hailey, who bought it for the auction. She assures Jay that she wouldn't have kept any of the money for herself. As she picks up the issues Jay tore through, Jay uses the cursed comic to transform into Ferrus and kills her.

Micki and Ryan go to the auction house and talk to Mr. Briggs. They say that they're looking for the secret issue, and Briggs tells him that it should be there any minute and it is on the list. The owner is waiting until the last minute to bring it in. Briggs refuses to tell them who the owner is, citing confidentiality. Once Briggs leaves, Micki sneaks a look at his list and gets the owner's name. Ryan goes through Briggs' Rolodex and finds Hailey's address.

As the cousins drive to Hailey's address, they find Hailey's car. Hailey is dead and thrown through the windshield. The secret issue is gone, and one of Jay's heart pills is on the pavement. Ryan recognizes it from earlier when he saw Jay.

Ryan and Micki drive to Jay's house and peer in through the window. They see Jay burning the stolen issues in the fireplace, and Micki knocks at the front door. Jay goes to answer it, and Ryan breaks the window glass. The artist hears him and goes back to the fireplace, and throws the remaining issues into the fireplace. He grabs a poker and threatens Ryan, while Micki grabs the cursed comic from a nearby table next to the pointed award.

Jay confronts Micki, and Ryan grabs the secret issue out of the fireplace. When Micki drops the comic book, Jay grabs it and transforms into Ferrus. The secret issue shows the hero killing Ferrus with the award. Ryan picks up the award from the table and kills Ferrus with it. Ferrus collapses to the floor and transforms back into Jay. Dying, Jay asks Ryan how it feels to be a hero

Later, Micki tells Ryan that she's reading through his comics. She suggests that they go to a comic art festival, and looks at the award Ryan has kept. Ryan irritably tells her to leave him alone, and Micki says that she's sorry about what happened. Micki has cut out a photo of Jay and gives it to Ryan, and Ryan says that he never wanted to be a hero but just an artist. He offers to show Micki his drawings, and they joke about Ryan "showing her his etchings".

description: Micki and Ryan search for a cursed scarecrow that may be responsible for murder.
tags: ['cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'killer scarecrow', 'sacrifice', 'human sacrifice', 'scarecrow comes to life', 'cursed artifact', 'cursed object', 'scarecrow character', 'evil scarecrow', 'severed head', 'sickle', 'severed female head', 'decapitation', 'scarecrow', 'curse', 'cousin cousin relationship', 'farm']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At a remote farmhouse, David Meeno and his son Jordy are sitting at the kitchen table. David is going through his bills and tells Jordy that they're going to pay off all of them but it will take almost everything they have. He admits that their last crop was a disappointment but insists that they can't split them up. Jordy says that his dead wife is up in Heaven, looking out for them.

Outside, Marge Longacre, wearing a raincoat, watches the house. She goes to a nearby scarecrow with a photo of David pinned to its chest, and the scarecrow's head nods as it comes to life.

David puts Jordy to bed, and Jordy hugs his father before he goes into his bedroom. Downstairs, David senses something wrong and opens the backdoor. The scarecrow is there, wielding a scythe. When it moves toward David, David slams the door shut. Jordy hears the noise and looks down the stairs. Below, the scarecrow teleports into the house and kills David, cutting off his head.

Marge comes in as Jordy hides, and she picks up David's head and leaves.

The next day, Marge holds her arms up to the rising sun and smiles.

Later, Ryan and Micki drive to the nearby farming community of Riverdale. Ryan sent out mailers all over the country asking about the scarecrow listed in the manifest. Charlie Cobean responded to one mailer, asking them to come get the scarecrow. There's a postcard from Jack in Singapore, saying that it will take him another week before he finds the Icarus Feather.

In Riverdale, Ryan gets directions to the Cobean farm. Micki tosses Ryan an old baseball that she found in the store. It's signed from Ryan to Jimmy, and Ryan snaps at her for bringing it and then dismisses it as nothing. They talk to Charlie and his wife Tudy, and Charlie says that he's never heard of them and didn't write the note. Tudy blurts out that they bought the scarecrow from Lewis, and Charlie says that it burned up in a crop fire three years ago.

As the cousins go, Micki asks to use the Cobeans' bathroom. Micki whispers to Ryan to keep the Cobeans talking, and she finds a man locked in a closet. He growls and comes at Micki, choking her. Charlie hears the noise, comes, and shoves the man back in the closet. Charlie tells the cousins that the man, Nick, is their boy and their business. He tells them to leave, and outside Ryan says that the Cobeans were lying. The antiques can't be destroyed so the scarecrow couldn't have been destroyed in a crop fire. Ryan suggests that they scout.

The cousins traipse over the countryside and finds a neighboring farm. They spot an empty scarecrow post on a nearby hill, and Marge comes up and demands to know who they are. Micki says that they're antique dealers, and Marge tells them to mind their curiosity. Marge introduces herself and says that she was taking some good to Nick. She admits that the Cobeans are careful to keep Nick protected, and suggests that they stay at the Longacre Inn that she owns and runs single-handedly.

Marge continues to the Cobean house, and immediately tells the couple that she's heard they have some visitors. The Cobeans quickly let her in.

That night at the inn, Marge is delivering linens when Ryan notices a photo of her and a man on the wall. When he comments on it, Marge says that the man is her husband and she buried him. Once she leaves, Micki says that Tudy tried to tell him something at the Cobean farm. Marge is on the stairs and hears them talking.

Tudy sneaks out of the house once Charlie dozes off in front of the TV. Marge watches her go, and pins a photo of Tudy to the scarecrow's chest. Tudy makes her way through the forest in the fog, and the scarecrow appears and Tudy runs through the cornfield, into Riverdale, and down the main street. She gets to the inn and makes it to the front porch. The scarecrow appears and cuts off her head with its scythe.

Inside in her room, Micki hears Tudy scream and goes out to investigate. She finds Tudy's head on the floor and sees the scarecrow standing nearby, and yells for Ryan. Ryan runs downstairs from his room, but by the time he gets to the front door, the scarecrow is gone. Tudy's decapitated body is there but there's no sign of her head. As Micki says that she saw the scarecrow, Marge comes down from her room and Ryan tells her that there's been an accident. He goes back to Micki, and Marge smiles in satisfaction.

Later, Sheriff Comins arrives to take Micki's statement. She claims that she didn't see anyone, including the scarecrow. Once Comins goes, Micki tells Ryan that the scarecrow came to life and has a photo of Tudy pinned to its chest. Comins overhears her but figures she's rehearsing her story to get in the newspapers.

The next day, Comins visits the inn and asks Marge if Micki and Ryan are around. They aren't, and Comins mentions Micki saying that she saw the scarecrow. The coroner's report confirms that Trudy was decapitated with a scythe, and there was cornstalks in Tudy's hands.

Micki and Ryan go to a local co-op store and buy an antique part from the owner, Nate. Micki mentions the Cobeans, and Nate says that they have been doing well the last few years and don't need petty cash. Nate tells them that the Cobeans have been buying up nearby farms, and Charlie wasn't much of a farmer until his luck changed overnight. The cousins ask if there have been a lot of disappearances of people that were unexpected, and Nate mentions David's disappearance a week ago along with Jordy

As the cousins drive to the Meeno place, Nate is out chopping wood and sees them. Marge is with him, and comments that he really likes Micki. She says that Micki is a wild one that needs to broke good, and Nate goes back to chopping wood with an axe.

The Meeno farm is for sale, and Micki wonders where the scarecrow is. The cousins split up and Ryan checks the house. He notices that there is partially-eaten food on the table.

Micki looks around outside and finds a trail of blood. She follows it to a partially-constructed barn and sees a tarp-wrapped bundle inside.

Jordy grabs Ryan from behind and tackles him to the floor, then runs off.

Micki approaches the bundle and finds a basket holding rotten tomatoes underneath it.

Ryan grabs Jordy and gets him to calm down.

The scarecrow comes at Micki and swings at her with its scythe. She ducks out of the way and runs, screaming. Ryan and Jordy hear her and look out the window, and see the scarecrow chasing Micki. She trips and it prepares to kill her, and Comins arrives and shoots it dead. As Ryan and Jordy run out, Comins pulls the mask off the scarecrow and discovers that it's Nick. Ryan suggests that Nick killed David, and Comins agrees. The sheriff explains that he came looking for them, and figures that killing Nick put an end to the murders. Ryan offers to look after Jordy, and Comins says that Jordy has an aunt but it might take a while to track her down

That night at the inn, Ryan cleans Jordy up and puts him to bed. Marge checks in on Jordy and confirms that he hasn't said anything, and as she goes she asks Ryan to let her know if Jordy says anything.

Micki comes in, leaving her bag on the hallway table.

Ryan lays next to Jordy, telling a funny story. Jordy finally smiles, and Ryan tells him to get some sleep. As Ryan leaves, he runs into Micki and they go out in the hallway. Meanwhile, Marge takes Micki's driver's license from her bag.

In one of their rooms, Ryan says that Jordy reminds him of his younger brother, Jimmy. He explains that when he and Jimmy were out playing baseball on the street, a truck jackknifed and killed Jimmy. Micki figures that Jordy reminds him of Jimmy, and Ryan says that there's something about him. Returning to the present, Ryan asks Micki what she found out. She says that three people go missing every harvest and so far David and Tudy are the only ones who have disappeared, and the harvest has two days yet to go. Ryan figures that the scarecrow has to find one more victim. Jordy overhears them, comes in, and says that he can help them.

At home, Charlie gets some papers out of a drawer and then starts to make a call. He hears something outside the window and puts the phone down, and tucks the papers into his pocket.

Jordy says that he didn't see the face of the person who took his father's head, but only that they wear wearing a raincoat. Marge is listening outside the door and walks away. Meanwhile, Jordy says that when he and David went to the Cobeans, Jordy saw the scarecrow there. The trio prepare to drive to the Cobean farmhouse, and Micki discovers that her driver's license is gone and her picture was on it. Marge listens from hiding as Jordy says that David lost a photo of himself a couple of days before he died. The cousins figure a photo is how the scarecrow locates its victims, and Ryan tells Micki that they have to get her somewhere safe like the sheriff's office.

Marge leaves the inn and goes to the sheriff's office

Ryan figures that the person controlling the scarecrow set it up to make Nick look like the scarecrow, putting Comins off the real killer's trail. The trio go to the sheriff's office and find Comins outside. Comins agrees to watch over Micki, while Ryan and Jordy go to the Cobean house. Marge watches Micki and Comins go inside from the around the corner of the building.

Charlie hears something rattling at the window, but looks outside and sees nothing.

Marge gets the scarecrow and says that Micki will be surprised. Charlie comes up to the attic where he's keep the scarecrow, and tells Marge to get her hands off of the antique. He says that Marge killed Tudy and Nick, and that the entire thing stops there. Marge isn't impressed, and Charlie trains his shotgun on her. The woman secretly picks up a baling hook and approaches Charlies, saying that he's a good-looking man. Marge says that she never planned to hurt Charlie's family, and she paid Charlie good when he was going to sell cheap. She tells Charlie that he should put down the gun and they can have some fun. Charlie lowers the shotgun, and Marge kisses him... and then kills him with the baling hook.

Later, Ryan and Jordy check the Cobean barn and find it filled with scarecrows dangling from the rafters. Jordy doesn't recognize any of them as the killer scarecrow, but blood is dripping down. Ryan finds Charlie's body hanging among the scarecrows.

Micki talks about keeping secrets to Comins, and Comins says that he has lots of secrets. He goes to get Micki a blanket from the closet, and Micki sees a raincoat like the one that Jordy described. She shoves Comins into the closet and locks the door, then runs out.

Jordy goes to the farm house to try and call Comins, but gets no answer. Ryan has found the papers, which are a bill of sale. They show that Charlie sold the farm three years ago, and when Ryan sees the buyer's name he tells Jordy that they have to go.

Micki returns to the inn and finds Marge there. The girl asks if Ryan is there, and Marge says that it's just the two of them.

Ryan and Jordy drive to the sheriff's office and go inside.

Marge takes Micki to her room and tells her to relax. She goes, locking the door from the outside, and Micki pounds on the door and yells to Marge. The scarecrow is under the quilt on the bed and sits up, wielding its scythe. Micki's license is pinned to its chest. Marge hears Micki scream and continues knitting.

The scarecrow advances on Micki, and she avoids its swings.

After Ryan releases Comins, the trio go to the inn. Marge hears them coming and picks up a pair of scissors. She sneaks up on Comins and stabs him in the back, then grabs Jordy and threatens to kill him if Ryan doesn't stay back. When Jordy calls to Ryan, Ryan goes berserk, kicks the scissors out of Marge's hands, and attacks her.

The scarecrow continues swinging and missing at Micki, cutting through the door. Micki burst through the door and runs downstairs. Marge has kicked Ryan off and run, and the scarecrow teleports downstairs and intercepts Micki. Ryan jumps on its back, but it shrugs Ryan off and advances on Micki again. Ryan recovers and grabs the scythe, and Micki yanks the license off of the scarecrow's chest. It collapses, inert, and Marge runs out screaming and attacks them with the scissors.

Ryan grapples with her, and Marge hits the photo of her and her husband. The photo falls on the scarecrow, and it activates and kills Marge with its scythe. The photo falls off its chest, and the scarecrow goes inert again.

The next day, the cousins give their statements to Comins. Jordy is waiting for them outside the office, and Ryan tells Jordy that there's nothing to worry about. He gives the boy the baseball and Jordy asks who Jimmy is. Ryan tells him about his younger brother.

As the cousins drive out of Riverdale, Micki wonders what the scarecrow did with the heads. Behind them the scarecrow crossbeam falls over.

description: An unscrupulous faith healer discovers a powerful glove that turns him into a killer.
tags: ['glove', 'faith healer', 'cousins', 'objects', 'female role lead', 'male role lead', 'search for lost object', 'fear', 'sacrifice', 'human sacrifice', 'cursed object', 'wearing one glove', 'evangelist', 'con artist', 'faith healing', 'lost glove', 'healing', 'con man', 'expose', 'television evangelist', 'exposed as fraud', 'magical glove', 'corruption', 'cursed glove', 'leather glove', 'tv evangelist', 'healing power', 'televangelist', 'embroidered glove', 'white glove', 'magic glove', 'phony', 'exposed', 'fraudster', 'exposing fraud', 'fraudulent scheme', 'frauding', 'calling someone a fraud', 'fraud', 'faith healing attempt', 'reference to a faith healer', 'disease', 'body horror', 'mutation', 'television']
synopsis_with_character_names:
At a mission, the crippled and infirm line up on stage as congregants look on. One of them is Jerry Scott, in a wheelchair. One at a time they are brought up to faith healer Steve Fishoff. Fishoff talks about his next "patient" a young man blinded by cataracts. The faith sealer says that he can heal the blind boy when doctors can't, and has everyone chant their belief.

Jerry stands up and says that he doesn't believe, and neither should the congregants. He says that what everyone is witnessing is a crime, and Fishoff insists that Jerry is drunk and they're witnessing the work of the Devil. Jerry asks the blind teenager what the color of his hair is, and the teenager insists that he's blind. When Fishoff says that the teenager just wants to be healed, Jerry steps forward and removes contact lenses from the teenager's eyes. Fishoff slips away while the congregants gasp in shock.

Fishoff flees out into an alley, and one of his "patients" finds him and calls him a crook. The fraud runs away, and runs into more of the infirm. They recognize him and he runs, and falls into a pile of garbage. Fishoff finds a white Italian Renaissance glove and puts it on, both curious and compelled. The charlatan laughs in triumph as he feels the glove's power, and a crippled woman hits him when she finds him.

The deformed woman, cursed with boils, curses Fishoff for not healing her as he promised. Fishoff insists that he didn't promise anything, and blames it on God's will. The woman accuses Fishoff of taking everything she had, and falls on Fishoff, He instinctively touches her face with his gloved hand. She's healed and cries in relief, while Fishoff stares at the glove in shock and then slips away.

The boils from the woman's affliction spread tenfold from the glove into Fishoff's body, He stares at the boils in horror, and a policeman sees him and comes over, assuming Fishoff is drunk. Fishoff touches his face, and the boils spread to the cop and he collapses to the ground, his body a mass of suppurating lesions while Fishoff is healed.

A year later at Curious Goods, Ryan is trying to get the TV to come in as Micki looks on. They get a commercial of Fishoff talking about how he was a different person six months ago. Ryan records the commercial on the VCR, and Jack comes in. Fishoff puts on the glove and says that he has the power. Jack recognizes the glove as an antique he brought it back from Rome after one of his terms in the Merchant Marine. The glove was made for Antonio Storza, an alchemist, by his court physician, and it provided good health for the elite. The glove is listed in the manifest, and Jack wonders at what cost the glove heals people.

The trio go to Fishoff's mission, and two of the guards usher Jack out when he tries to break in to Fishoff's office. Jack tells them to follow Fishoff if he leaves, while he looks for another way in. The cousins wait on a fire escape until Fishoff leaves by himself. They split up to follow him.

A woman takes her dog out to walk him, and the dog walks away. The woman runs after her dog, and a stricken Fishoff grabs the dog's leash and takes it to the owner. Fishoff grabs her hand when she reaches for the leash, transferring the ailments that he's absorbed into her. The glove is rendered pristine, while the woman dies horribly. After Fishoff walks away, the cousins join back up and find the woman's corpse. They realize someone used the glove to kill her.

Later back at the store, the cousins tells Jack what happened. Jack speculates on what the curse is, and figures who he needs to ask for help to get close to Fishoff. He tells Micki that he needs to see his contact alone, because he's "decidedly peculiar". Jack goes to the freighter where Jerry lives, and finds Jerry watching a video of another faith healer and taking notes. The two friends warmly greet each other and Jerry figures that he's debunked 400 "parasite" in the last 20 years. None of them close to being the real thing. Jack jokingly argues that Jerry has just never met a real faith healer, and Jerry says that they'll never see eye to eye on belief versus skepticism.

Jack says that he needs Jerry's help against Fishoff. Jerry has heard that Fishoff is back, and Jack hopes that he can get to Fishoff now. When Jerry wonder why Jack is involved with a small-timer like Fishoff, Jack brings up a video of Fishoff healing a crippled man with the glove. He says that Fishoff is a fraud but the glove gives him the power to heal.

Jerry accepts Jack's statement for the sake of argument, and Jake tells him that there are unpleasant side effects. Jack's friend demonstrates his own psychic abilities with spoon-bending, and sarcastically wonders if he should go out and heal the "wounded world". Jack warns that the bigger Fishoff gets, the more dangerous he'll get. Jerry confirms that Jack believes the glove can heal any disease, and asks Jack what he wants him to do.

Later at the mission, Jerry approaches Fishoff and says that he's been impressed with his recent success. Fishoff strokes the glove and Jerry says that he'll admit if he was wrong. The faith healer says that there is a power greater than both of them running through him, and Jerry dismisses it as greed. Fishoff insists that he can really do it, and wonders why Jerry is doing it. Jerry says that he can prove Fishoff is a fraud and a hypocrite, and this time he'll break him for good. Fishoff accepts Jerry's challenge.

Back on the freighter, Jerry tells Jack that he found a terminally ill "patient" for Fishoff. The person will die if a miracle isn't found, and Jack says that they can't let Fishoff kill someone because of the price to be paid. Jerry doesn't care that someone else will die, and tells Jack that he no longer has a say in it. When Jack wonders what the matter is with Jerry, Jerry pulls up his sheet to reveal the lesions on his chest. Jack realizes that Jerry is the patient and says that he can't be, and Jerry says that he has no choice. He takes out a revolver and aims it at Jack, and says that it's ironic that after his years of disbelief, the one person who can save him is a faith healer.

At the store, Ryan and Micki worry about Jack not having returned yet. Ryan figures that Jack can handle it, but Micki isn't convinced.

Jerry ties up Jack, who warns that the glove will kill someone. His friend says that he can't afford to care about that, and hopes Jack is right and he's wrong about the supernatural. Fishoff pulls up in his car and stations his bodyguard outside while he goes in. Jerry is waiting for Fishoff, and Jerry asks if Fishoff brought the glove. Fishoff confirms that he did, and Jerry says that he's the patient. He tells Fishoff that he's dying, and Fishoff says that he can heal anything but he's hated Jerry's guts for years and now has his life in his hands. With that, Fishoff puts the glove on.

Ryan figures that they should go get Jack because something has gone wrong. He gets Jerry's address from Jack's address book.

Fishoff asks Jerry if he believes, and advances on him. He tells Jerry to kneel to him, and Jerry does so. Fishoff demands that Jerry say loudly that he believes, and touches his ungloved hand to Jerry's head. The faith healer shoves Jerry back, and Jerry realizes that he's still dying. Fishoff jokingly says that he must have used the wrong, hand, and removes and pockets the glove.

Jerry draws his revolver and tells Fishoff to heal him or he'll kill him. He fires a shot into the air to demonstrate he's serious, and the bodyguard runs in. Jerry shoots him dead, and Fishoff runs after him as Jerry gives chase. As Fishoff gets in his car, Jerry shoots him in the back. Fishoff collapses into the front seat of his car, and puts on the glove to heal himself as Jerry comes down the gangplank after him.

Fishoff drives off but, weakened, wedges his car in behind a dumpster. Finding a gunshot wound on the glove and realizing he has to get rid of the damage before the glove kills him with it, Fishoff tries to get out of the car but discovers the door is jammed against the dumpster. Jerry arrives as Fishoff opens the car window and begs for help. The debunker laughs hysterically, and gunshot wounds spread across Fishoff's body.

Jerry takes the glove and goes back to his cabin. He trains his gun on Jack and finds that Jack has already slipped his ropes. Jack figures that Jerry killed Fishoff, and Jerry figures that he can heal himself and then will need Jack afterward. Jerry has Jack sit down in his cabin, then touches the glove to his chest and heals himself.

Ryan and Mick arrive outside and go aboard the freighter.

Jerry realizes that he's healed, and the glove is covered with his lesions. He advances on Jack, saying that he's sorry, and Jack tries to run. He forces the gloved hand back on Jerry's face, and Jerry screams in agony as the lesions appear back on his body tenfold. The cousins arrive as the dying Jerry begs Jack to pray for him. Jack says that he will as his friend dies, and the glove returns to its pristine state.

Later back at the store, Jack is kicking at a crate in frustration. He tells Micki that Jerry was his friend and Jerry tried to kill. Jack bemoans what his "friends" have done to him, and tells Micki that he wants to leave. As Ryan comes in, Micki tells Jack that maybe they'd be better off if Jack considers them liabilities. Ryan interrupts, calming them both down. He assures Jack that he still has friends and they're his friends. Jack calms down and offers Ryan an ancient remedy for his head cold, and Micki suggests chemicals and proposes a contest of magic versus scientist. Ryan leaves in disgust when they start betting on which of them can cure him.
